loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Every farmer aspires to have a fruitful harvest and earn a sufficient income to satisfy his family's needs. Likewise, Roberto aimed to have a plentiful harvest to support his family and educate his children. Roberto is now 50 years old and has three children; they enjoy living in a rural community where they are able to plant rice and vegetables and raise livestock for sale. Roberto has been a farmer for almost 25 years and usually earns an income of 25,000 PHP every harvest season. His income goes to his family's food and clothing and allowances for his children who are in school. 

To improve his farming business, Roberto is asking for additional capital of 23,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for his rice farming. He is hoping that his farming business will become fruitful to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in rice farming

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Yei. She sells fish, a business she has been in for two years. She is 25 years old and married and she has two children, both of whom are still in school. 

Susan heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is 35 years old, married and had three young children. She operates a small store selling grocery items to the people in her village. Her spouse is a farmer. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to increase her merchandise. She will buy biscuits, eggs, breads and canned goods to sell. Some day she hopes to keep making the business profitable and keep offering friendly services.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, eggs, breads and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia lives in Liwan Sur with her spouse and three children. She manages a small store which she relies upon for income. Virginia's spouse is a rice farmer. They work untiringly to acquire income for the education of their children. Now, Virginia would like to increase her sales for additional income, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to invest in her store. She will buy soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, milk and sugar to sell in her store. 

With continuous profits from their businesses, she hopes to gain enough funds for her children's education. She will be very happy and proud if they will finish a degree someday.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, milk and sugar to sell in her store.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is 55 years old, a widow who had three children. Raising hogs is her business. Upon reaching maturity, she sells them to butchers in her village. She usually earns about PHP 4,000 for each hog she sells. She aspires to develop her business so she is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy hog feed, medicines and vaccines for sustainability. 

Melita would like to keep ensuring good growth of her hogs to earn additional revenue. This will lead to financial stability someday.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, medicines and vaccines for sustainability.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 49 years old, a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. To make a living, her spouse is a farmer while Marcelina sells rice to the people in her village. From each sack of rice she sells, she gains about PHP 450 in profit. She would like to buy six sacks of rice to sell but she lacks sufficient funds. She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to invest in her rice vending business.

Although her business is small, Marcelina would like to further improve it and someday save funds to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 27 years old and a single parent. She has one child and lives with her parents. Maricel runs a store to earn a living. From her business, she earns about PHP 3,000 each month. The money pays for meals and infant formula milk for her child. She would like to sell more grocery items so she is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, bread, and eggs to sell.

In the future, Maricel would like to further develop her store to earn additional funds and provide a fortunate life for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, bread, and eggs to sell

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Raising hogs is Jesusa's business. She sells them to butchers in her village when they reach the desired weight. She has been in this business over two years and earns about PHP 3,000 for each hog sold. Jesusa is 46 years old and has four children. Two of them attend school. Her spouse is a farmer. 

Jesusa would like to ensure good growth and nutrition for her hogs in order to increase her profits. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy feed and medicines for her hogs. She hopes to keep growing as a successful entrepreneur to ensure the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her hogs

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 39 years old, married, and has five children. She is married to a farmer named Daniel. Juliet raises hogs to sell in the future. Together, she and Daniel work hard for family's sustenance. All of her children are attending to school and in need of daily allowances.

Juliet would like to ensure that the business is profitable, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines to sustain her hogs. These inputs will help improve the hogs' growth and nutrition. 

With continuous effort and determination, Juliet and her family hope to achieve an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines for her hogs' sustenance

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen owns a clothing business. He is married with two children and has been in this business for three years. He started as a farmer, saved and started his current business so as to supplement his income.He faces challenges of price fluctuations and inflation, high taxes among others. His family goal is to educate his children and build a permanent house. He wishes to expand his business to new markets.Stephen intends to use the loan for purchasing clothes to add to his stock.

loans.use: to buy  clothes for sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian lives in Yei. She sells at a food stall, and she has been in the business for five years. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are still in school. 

Vivian heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase onions and tomatoes to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a hardworking mother who helps her husband manage their rice farming business to increase their yields and income to satisfy their needs and finance the education of their three children. Despite the hardship of living they have the determination to improve their status of living and give their children a bright future. They have been farmers for almost 18 years and usually earn an income of P23,000 in every cropping season. 

They aim to expand their rice plantation to increase production. Luzviminda is asking for a loan of P28,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in their rice farming business. They believe that their patience and hard work will enable them to make an improvement in their farming business, and they hope that they will have a fruitful harvest so that they will continuously support their children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in her rice farming business

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Mycel

texts.en:
Mycel is a single parent who lives with her parents in a rural community. They own and manage a rice farming business to earn a living. She is 36 years old and has one infant-aged child. She aims to earn more income to satisfy their needs and save for the future of her child. Despite the problems and difficulties she encountered in life, she is confident about improving their living conditions.

She aims to have a fruitful harvest to ensure a higher income. She is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for the maintenance of rice production. She hopes that her patience and hard work will enable her to reach her goals in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the maintenance of rice production

location.town: Brgy. Munguia,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Villamor

texts.en: Villamor is a father who owns and manages a rice farming business in his community. He is 55 and has eight grown up children. His ambition in life is to educate his children and give them a better life. In this regard, he aimed to increase his yields and income to cover his family’s necessities and finance the education of his children. To improve his farming business, he wants to borrow a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and pesticides needed for rice farming. He believes that his patience and hard work will enable him to improve his farming business. He is hoping that he will become more successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for rice farming.

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Yei. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for five years. She is 34 years old, married, and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Christine heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Reida

texts.en:
Reida lives in Yei. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for five years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Reida heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi est  un homme âgé de 34 ans. Il est marié å une coiffeuse. Il a 03 enfants.
Kossi travaille comme boucher depuis 2000. Il exerce son activité au marché et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Kossi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bœufs et des moutons. Il veut agrandir l’activité et assurer une meilleure éducation pour la famille.
texts.en: Kossi is a 34-year-old man.  He is married to a hairdresser, and has three children.  Kossi has been working as a butcher since 2000. He does business at the market, and stocks up in Lome. Kossi is asking for his fist loan through WAGES so that he can purchase beef and mutton.  He would like to grow his business and ensure the best education for his family.

loans.use: to purchase beef and mutton.

loans.name: Ekouessan

texts.fr: Mr Ekouessan est âgé de 41ans. Il est infirmier de profession. Il exerce son activité à domicile et sollicite ce quatrième de WAGES pour aménager son cabinet médical. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité, ouvrir un autre cabinet pour mieux s’occuper des patients. Il veut construire sa propre maison et assurer l’avenir de la famille. Notons qu’il a démarré en 2005. Il est marié à une revendeuse et est père de 02 enfants tous scolarisés. Le premier a 06ans et le dernier 04ans.
texts.en:
Mr. Ekouessan is 41 years old, and is a nurse by profession. He operates at home and is requesting this fourth credit loan from WAGES to rearrange his medical office.

He wants to reinvest in the business, open another medical office to take better care of patients. He wants to build his own house and secure the future of the family. It should be noted that he began practicing in 2005.

He is married to a retail merchant and is the father of two children, four and six years old, both of whom attend school.

loans.use: Refurbish his medical office

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa est une femme âgé  de 24ans. Elle est mariée à un commerçant et a enfant de 01ans.
Akossiwa travaille comme revendeuse de maïs  dans un marché de la place. Elle vend seule et sa difficulté principale est la mévente.
Akossiwa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de maïs. Elle veut élargir son étalage, vendre en gros et assurer l’avenir de la famille.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a 24-year-old woman.  She is married to a merchant and has a 1-year-old child.

Akossiwa works as a corn re-seller in a marketplace. She sells on her own, and her biggest problem is slow sales.  Akossiwa has asked for her first loan through WAGES in order to purchase bags of corn.  She wants to expand her display, sell by wholesale, and ensure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn.

loans.name: Ambroise

texts.fr: Agé de 42ans et marié à une revendeuse, Ambroise est papa de 03 enfants tous scolarisés. Le premier a 09ans et le dernier 03ans. Vu qu’il n’ya pas assez  de meunier dans leur quartier pour répondre aux besoins des clients, il a décidé de créer en 2008 un moulin pour moudre du maïs, du mil, du sorgho et autres. Il le fait à la maison et sa difficulté est l’insuffisance de fonds. Il sollicite de WAGES ce premier prêt pour acheter des accessoires pour monter le moulin. Il veut avec le profit ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation générale et avoir un second moulin.
texts.en:
42 years old and married to a trader, Ambroise is the father of 3 children - all of whom attend school. The eldest is 9 and the youngest 3 years old. As there are not enough millers in the area to meet local demand, he decided to start a mill in 2008 in order to grind corn, meal, sorghum and others. He does this at his home, and his main problem is a lack of funds. 
He is seeking this first loan through WAGES in order to buy accessories to build the mill. With the profit, he wants to open a small grocery store and to have a second mill.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for building his mill

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr:
Akoko est une femme âgé(e) de 40ans. Elle est veuve et a un enfant de 10ans qui est scolarisé.
Akoko travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes depuis 1987 Elle exerce l’activité de façon ambulante et sa difficulté est la mévente.
Akoko a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes. Elle veut assurer l’avenir de son unique enfant et agrandir l’activité.
texts.en:
Akoko is a 40-year-old woman.  She is a widow with one 10-year-old child who is in school.  
Akoko has been working as a retailer selling pagnes since 1987.  She does business as an itinerant, but she faces the problem of slow sales. 
Akoko is asking for her second loan through WAGES in order to buy pagnes.  She wants to provide for the future of her only child and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase pagnes.

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en:
Kholoud is 40 years old and a married woman. Her husband is a baker.

Kholoud has recently started a small home-based business to help the family in finding another income. Her business was basically buying and selling evening and party dresses. She chose to start selling this type of clothes because she found that those dresses are very expensive in the market, so she went to buy different models from a wholesale market and from the free zone area and sold them at a reasonable and affordable price.

Now that a lot of people in the neighborhood know that Kholoud is selling dresses, she wants to add selling casual clothes beside the dresses to increase her revenue, and for that reason she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to add on selling casual clothes

loans.name: Nuzha

texts.en:
Nuzha, 51 years old and a divorced woman, is an employee in a school. 

Nuzha has started a business at home to improve her living conditions. She started buying and selling clothes and blankets to friends, neighbors and relatives.

Now Nuzha wants to buy more clothes for different ages to increase her profit, and for that reason she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for different ages

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 29 year old married woman. She has 2 children who range is age from 2 years old to 6 years old. She describes herself to be an honest woman.

Rose operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located near a busy town and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the loan of 50,000 KES to buy more clothes for selling.

This is the second loan she is requesting with SMEP DTM. The first one she managed to pay full the amount owed. Rose's business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy dairy cows using the profits generated.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Ruba

texts.en:
Ruba is a conservative single lady, so she asked her mother to take her place in the photo.

Ruba is 23 years old and she has six brothers and sisters. She has opened a small food products market to help the family in improving their living conditions.  She has applied for this youth loan to bring in missing products and to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to bring in products she is missing and to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a newer sewing machine, more material and threads

loans.name: Everiyne

texts.en:
Everiyne is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya and produces milk for the local market. She has been in active farming for the last seven years. She is married with four children who are still in school.
	
Everiyne has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says this will boost her farming income and meet the family needs with more ease. She plans to buy more dairy cows and a motorcycle to help transport her farm produce to the local market.

Everiyne appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loans services and is optimistic she will be able to acquire more assets though she laments of high costs of dairy feeds and animal diseases.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Germana

texts.en:
Germana is a mother of five children aged between twenty and five years. She lives with her family in their rural home in Kitale, where she carries out her farming. She sells her maize, beans, eggs, and milk to the local market. She earns some additional income from teaching at the local school.

Germana has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to buy more poultry to expand her farming business. She aspires to have a flock of more than three hundred birds and continues to grow the number as time passes by.

Germana runs her farm with the help of one farmhand and says common poultry diseases are the major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy poultry for her business

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a mother of twelve children who are all adults, save for the last born who is seventeen and still in school. She has been farming in her rural area for thirty years and currently produces and sells milk, maize, beans, vegetables, and fruits, which help her in meeting her family's needs.

Leah has made a loan request of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry for a new venture into poultry farming. She is optimistic on the returns from her poultry business. It will help her improve her dairy farming as well and earn more income to educate her last-born child.

Leah says Juhudi Kilimo loans have really empowered her over the years by making her a much better farmer. She, however, notes the challenges of poultry diseases as being very costly.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Muhoi

texts.en:
Muhoi is a resident and a farmer in Murang'a in Central Kenya, where he lives with his family. He has three children who are 17, 13 and 8 years old. His farm produces milk, tea, tomatoes, and cereals for the local market.

Muhoi has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry and construct a poultry unit. He believes his poultry business will meet his family's basic needs and boost his other businesses. His goal is to own a farm with more than two cows.

He says he is challenged by insecurity, dry spells, and limited access to capital.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Suad

texts.en:
Suad, 46 years old, is a conservative woman who asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Suad is a mother of four sons and daughters and her husband is a taxi driver.
 
Suad wanted to help her husband support the family, so she decided to start a small retail business selling blankets and bed covers. Now she wants to expand the business by adding more variety of  what she sells. Therefore, she has applied for this loan in order to buy home products.

loans.use: to buy a variety of bed covers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her inventory of mud pots

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 32-year-old married man. He has a child who is two years old. He describes himself to be honest and determined. 

Patrick operates a retail store where he sells home products such as flour, sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, etc. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located within a shopping market and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds for expanding the business. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy bags of sugar, baskets, rice, and bales of wheat flour and maize flour. Patrick had taken two earlier loans, for which he managed to pay the whole amount owed. His business goal is to add stock to his retail store within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will use the anticipated profits in running a wholesale shop and educating his children.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, rice, and bales of wheat flour, baskets and maize flour.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 38-year-old married man. He has two children aged two years and eight years. He describes himself to be a visionary and an intelligent man. He operates a motorcycle to provide transportation services. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located within a village, and his primary customers are village dwellers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. He will use the loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. This is the second loan he is requesting. The first one, he managed to repay the whole amount. His business goal is to run a spare parts retail shop. He hopes that in the future, he will use the anticipated profits to run a larger spare parts business.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a married man. He has two children, who are six and eleven years old. He describes himself to be determined and focused. He operates a vehicle to provide transportation. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located within a fast-growing town, and his primary customers are within the town and the city. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving his business. He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy vehicle spare parts. This is the first time, Wilson is taking a loan. His business goal is to own several taxis within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will use the anticipated profits in buying his own car for his business.

loans.use: To buy vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Faraja Group

texts.fr:
Marc  partie du groupe Faraja et habite à Bujumbura. Il a  59 ans et est marié à  Marie, commerçante d’orange. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants, âgés  de 14 à 21 ans, tous étudient.

Il fait la fabrication et le commerce de savons depuis 25ans.

Il est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de matières premières (huile de noix de palme, soude caustique,…)pour la fabrication de beacoup de savons, à vendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  développer le travail de fabrication de savon, ouvrir un atelier de couture.
texts.en:
Marc is a member of the Faraja group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 59 years old and is married to Marie, an orange vendor. They have 4 children together who range in age between 14 and 21 years of age. All their children go to school.

Mark has been making and selling soap for 25 years.

This is his second credit with Turame. With his KIVA credit, he will increase his capital and buy a large amount of raw materials (palm kernel oil, caustic soda, etc.) to make soap that he will sell later to earn more money.

Over the course of the next few years, he would like to develop his soap making work and open a clothing workshop.

loans.use: increase his capital and buy a large amount of raw materials (palm kernel oil, caustic soda, etc.), to make soap.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is 32 years old, single and lives in Ibb, Yemen. He has owned a house for many years. He inherited this house after his father died. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas. He applied for a loan of 100,000 YER to buy cement and iron to build the ceiling of his house. He is aiming to open a commercial enterprise to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to have a better life and get married.

loans.use: to buy cement and iron to build the ceiling of his house

loans.name: Elsa Arelí

texts.es: Elsa Arelí, es una mujer de 36 años de edad trabajadora y responsable, vive en casa propia junto a sus dos hijas de 20 y 14 años, quienes aún están estudiando. Elsa es quien provee al hogar todo lo necesario para vivir. Por lo que, desde hace muchos años diariamente se traslada para vender pupusas en un local de fácil acceso ubicado, atrás de un hotel, en una calle muy transitada del país, lo que contribuye a contar con una muy buena clientela. Con los ingresos que obtiene de la pupusería, Elsa está esforzándose por mejorar las condiciones en las que vive. Es por ello que, solicita un préstamo para invertir en la instalación del servicio de electricidad de su casa, como un esfuerzo para tener acceso a mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Elsa Arelí, 36, is a hardworking and responsible woman.  She lives in her own house with her two daughters, ages 20 and 14, who are still in school.  Elsa provides the household everything that is necessary to live.  For this reason, for many years she has gone to sell "pupusas" [stuffed tortillas] in an easily accessible place located behind a hotel on one of the busiest streets of the country.  This contributes to her having very good customers.

With the income she gets from the pupusa business, Elsa is making an effort to improve her living conditions.  This is why she is requesting a loan to invest in installing electricity in her house, as an effort to have access to better living conditions.

loans.use: to install electricity service.

loans.name: Hob Al-Yemen Group

texts.en:
The committee of woman named "Hob Al-Yemen" has been in existence as a group for many years. The group consists of six women:  Smah, Jihad, Fatima, Katba, Soad and Aisha. They all enjoy working and participating in their businesses. They are from Sana'a, Yemen. They are all friends and are always cooperative when they work because they want to help their families. They applied for a loan of 240,000 YER.

One of the members is Smah. She is a married woman and has two children. They live together in Sana'a, Yemen. She is a person who is known for being an entrepreneur and a hard worker. She is a tailor who sews all types of ladies clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to help her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fabrics and textiles to sew dresses, skirts, blouses, etc. for her business. As a result, she will have more variety to offer to her customers

loans.use: to buy fabrics and textiles to sew dresses, skirts, blouses, etc

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona, a 37-year-old conservative married lady, asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Mona works in the cleaning department in a school and her husband is a tailor. She started another business at home selling second-hand clothes, and using her husband’s experience, he helps her fix the torn clothes.

She has applied for this loan in order to buy a new sewing machine to help her husband, and to get more clothes to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and buy more clothes to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Khairiya

texts.en:
Khairiya is a 52-year-old married woman. Her husband is a butcher. They have two sons and a daughter.

Khairiya has a small retail business selling clothes, scarves, and makeup products. She has applied for this loan in order to increase the inventory she has of makeup so she can increase her revenue.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of makeup.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen wants a loan to buy salon assets, farm inputs, phones and phone accessories to sell. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is aged thirty-five and is married with two children. His dream is to educate his children and move his business to more permanent location. Inadequate capital affects his business. He has a number of business and the photo was taken a from his book store but the loan purpose is as stated above.

loans.use: to buy assets for the salon and farm inputs, phones and accessories.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is a 32-year-old man. He is married and a father to two sons and two daughters.

For one year, Hani has been opening a store for selling and maintaining mobile phones. This is the only source of income for his family and a profitable project, but he needs more support to cover his costs.

Hani is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more mobile phones to sell. This will enable Hani to offer his customers a new collection of mobile phones that they can buy, which will improve Hani's income and allow him to provide his family with better living conditions.

Hani is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Jenan

texts.en:
Jenan is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother, Kan'aan, appears in her Kiva profile photo. He is pictured in the family's house.

Jenan is a 20-year-old single woman. She is a tailor, and her brother Kan'aan is a worker.

Jenan wants the house to become livable soon, so she can live in it with her family.
   
Jenan is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to share with her family to cover the costs of installing tiles and painting the family's house. This will improve the family's living conditions and enable them to move into it soon.

loans.use: To finish her house by installing tiles and painting

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 37-year-old divorced woman and mother to three sons and three daughters who live with her. For the past five years, Eman has been operating a beauty salon located in the city's center, which is a good movement area, and her beauty salon has been profitable. But it is the only source of income for Eman and her children, and it needs more support to cover her family's needs and the costs.

Eman gives beauty training courses in her salon to women who wish to open beauty salons in the future, so Eman wants to expand her beauty salon by adding new decorations to the side that will be used for holding training courses.

Eman is requesting a 1,400 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the expenses of installing new decorations and improving the salon's condition. This will fund a suitable space to hold training courses in, increase the number of trainees and improve the family's income.
  
Eman is photographed in her beauty salon.

loans.use: To expand her beauty salon by adding new decorations.

loans.name: Kareema

texts.en:
Kareema is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured inside his taxi.

Kareema is a 44-year-old married woman and mother to five sons.  Her husband has been a taxi driver for seven years; it has been a profitable project, but needs more support to cover the family's needs and costs, especially since it is the only source of income to the family.

Kareema is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing licensing and insuring the taxi. This will allow Kareema's husband to move freely from one place to another and take more requests, which will lead to increased customers and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To pay for licensing and insuring the taxi.

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer is a 33-year-old young man, married and father to two sons.  He is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past four years, Tamer has also been selling mobile phones and their accessories, which has been a profitable project, but it needs more support to cover the costs.

Tamer is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a collection of modern mobile phones and their accessories. This will help Tamer offer his customers a wide variety of new and modern mobile phones to choose from and buy, which will increase sales and improve his family's income.

Tamer is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase a collection of modern mobile phones and their accessories to sell to customers.

loans.name: Zeyad

texts.en:
Zeyad is a 39-year-old married man and father to three sons.

For the past nine years, Zeyad has been operating a workshop for repairing vehicles and motorcycles. It has been profitable, but it needs more support to cover the family's needs and the costs.

Zeyad is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him purchase a crane to lift vehicles and motorcycles for repair. This will improve the quality of Zeyad's workshop by offering him the necessary basic tool to complete his work, which will maximize the size of his workload and help to improve the family's income.

Zeyad is photographed in his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase a crane to lift vehicles and motorcycles to repair.

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer is a 30-year-old man, married and a father to one son. He owns a local radio station, which is a successful and profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the costs.

Tamer wants to improve the tools he uses in his work, so he is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing mikes and mixer tools. This will enable Tamer to speak in a clearer voice and improve the quality of his work, which will help to increase customers' demand and improve the family's income.

Tamer is photographed in the radio station while he is introducing a program live on air.

loans.use: To purchase mikes and mixer tools

loans.name: Nabeel

texts.en:
Nabeel is a 53-year-old man. He is married and a father to five sons. 
Nabeel has a butcher shop located near a famous hotel in the city and he provides the hotel kitchen with all kinds of meat such as beef and chicken. This makes the butcher shop a profitable project, but Nabeel needs more support to cover the costs from time to time.

Nabeel is requesting a $2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more meat for sale. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.
Nabeel is photographed in his butcher shop.

loans.use: to purchase more meat for sale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 49-year-old man. He is married and a father to four sons, all of whom are school-age students under 18 years old.

For the past four years, Ahmad has been selling hot drinks such as coffee and tea to the public through a food stall, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to the family, but is not enough to cover the family's needs. Ahmad also needs more support to cover the costs.

Ahmad is requesting a $3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new stall and supplying it with a large quantity of tea and coffee to make hot drinks for customers. This will provide Ahmad with a new stall. Once he can move from one place to another through the day easily, the number of customers will increase and so he will increase sales and improve the family's income.
Ahmad is photographed next to his stall.

loans.use: to purchase a new stall and purchase more coffee and tea.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en: Khim is 51 years old. She is widowed and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice and fattening animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $2 per day. All of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $12 per day. Khim is requesting a loan of $1,000 to pay for her son’s passport expenses. This money will help her son work in Thailand legally and earn more money to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and rebuild her house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her son's passport expenses.

loans.name: Teum

texts.en: Teum is 56 years old. She is widowed and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been growing crops and fattening animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $2 per day. All of her children are employed. They earn about $16 per day. In order to improve her business, Teum is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase a walking tractor to use for farming. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a fence around her house.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor to use for farming.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is 33 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice and fattening animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a Khmer traditional musician who earns about $4 per day. One of her children is employed in a company and earns about $4 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Van is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase piglets to breed and resell. This will help her to earn more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and breed.

loans.name: Khley

texts.en: Khley is 30 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agriculture for more than five years and is successful in her career. She grows rice and raises poultry. She earns about $4 per day. Her husband is a farm worker who earns about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Khley is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase a walking tractor to use for farming and to rent out. This will help her earn more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to purchase more farmland to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to rebuild her house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor.

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en: Hoy is 51 years old. She is widowed and resides with her two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been running a grocery store for more than two years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her daughter is employed as a sales representative. She earns about $5 per day. Due to her family's transportation difficulties, Hoy is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Hearb

texts.en:
Hearb is 38 years old. She is widowed and resides with her mother and one child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish for more than ten years, earning approximately $8 per day. Her mother grows vegetables to sell and earns about $1 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Hearb is requesting a loan of $1000 to raise capital in her business in order to purchase more fish to sell. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business in order to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Sophea is 34 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling cake for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $8 per day. All her children are still in her care and in school. Sophea wants to build a new house. With this goal in mind, Sophea is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to build a house. This money will help her build a comfortable house and provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a house.

loans.name: Arn

texts.en: Arn is 67 years old. He is a father of three children and resides with his wife in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has been purchasing cattle to resell for more than twenty years, earning approximately $4 per day. His wife sells roasted chicken. She earns about $3 per day. All of his children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $10 per day. In order to improve his family’s finances, Arn is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase all kinds of drinks for his wife to resell at home. By doing so, his wife would earn extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase all kinds of drinks for his wife to resell at home.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch is 42 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than seven years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs a taxi service (Tuk Tuk taxi). He earns about $5 per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory as well. They earn about $6 per day. Because their Tuk Tuk is old, Touch is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new one for her husband to drive. This purchase would enable him to attract more customers and earn more money to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a new Tuk Tuk for her husband to run a taxi service.

loans.name: Hol

texts.en: Hol is 48 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a chef who earns about $4 per day. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about $3 per day. Hol wants to run an additional business to earn more income to support her family. With this goal in mind, Hol is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase farmland to use for agricultural crops cultivation. This money will help her acquire the security to start her business. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: To purchase farmland to use for agricultural crops cultivation

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 37-year-old man. He is married with no children yet. He is a taxi driver who gets a salary, but it is not enough to cover the family's needs and their expenses.

Mohammad is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more construction supplies to complete building his house and improving its condition. This will enable Mohammad and his family to complete building their house and live in a healthy and suitable condition.

Mohammad is photographed in the location of his house.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to complete building his house

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Yei. She sells food at a stall, and she has been in business for two years. She is 25 years old, married, and has three children (two of them are still in school).
 
Susan heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese Pounds in order to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and beans to sell

loans.name: Chantho

texts.en: Chantho is 33 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been producing palm sugar for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a palm fruit and coconut vendor who earns about $5 per day. All of her children are still in her care and in school. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Chantho is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer for carrying palm fruit and coconuts to sell. This purchase will help her husband carry palm fruit and coconuts to sell in larger amounts and earn more profit to support her family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a trailer for carrying palm fruit and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Phol

texts.en: Phol is 25 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than five years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs a taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about $5 per day. Her children are still in her care. Because the present motorbike is old, Phol is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run the taxi service. This purchase will help her husband attract more customers and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business to generate extra income to support the family and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to build a kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run the taxi service

loans.name: Syd Charisse

texts.en: 31 year-old Syd-Charisse has been working hard at her rice farming business in the village of San Juan for ten years. She has been gaining successes in this business with her enterprising nature and unfailing diligence. She sells most of her crops to the buying station for corn and rice in their town. Syd-Charisse is happily married and has two good-natured children. Her children are in school and doing well.  She says her sales return total Php 30,000 per crop. Her hope is that, once she puts her loan proceeds into good and efficient use, her business's prospects will see a new lease on life. She wants all the best for her family and business and she says she will go to every length, not only to improve on their current circumstances, but also to ensure that they all will enjoy a good and prosperous future. Syd Charisse is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 in order to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm. She says she will use this loan to purchase high grade manure to improve her crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Yeum

texts.en:
Yeum is 39 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops for more than twenty years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband runs the business of buying cattle to resell for a profitable price. He earns about $5 per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $6 per day.

In order to improve her family’s finances, Yeum is requesting a loan of $1000 for her husband to purchase more cattle to sell. By doing so, he should earn more profit to support the family. In the future, Yeum would like to expand the business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is 43 years old, and her husband, Von, is 43 years old. They live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1990, and they have three daughters--two are garment workers, and the other one is attending school. 

Mom and her husband are rice farmers. In addition, her husband also does construction work when he is not at the farm. Mom is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to fill in the land behind her house. There are some small ponds, so she needs to fill them in.   

Photo: Mom is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To fill in the land behind her house

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
At an early age, Pedro started to farm due to the living status of his family. With regards to his situation, Pedro doesn’t want to let his children experience what he went through, because he would like to see them have a good future someday.

To make his dreams come true, Pedro devotes his time to his corn field so that he can improve the growth of his corn crop and expand the farmland he manages. Pedro is a responsible father to his three children and a loving husband to Lydia. Aside from his farming business, Pedro has also involved himself in a hog raising business for more than 20 years. He is grateful, because the generated income from his farming business was used for his eldest child's education, and some was used for their household expenses. He plans to buy feed, because his place is far from the market, and he wants to economize his expenses in going to and from the market. To obtain his dreams, which is to uplift his living status out of poverty, he is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000. He hopes that the KIVA lenders and ASKI will grant his request for the loan amount.

loans.use: To buy feed for his hogs

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Benito has run his hog-raising business since 2011. He currently is raising seven hogs to be fattened and sold. Before he he started raising hogs, he operated his farming business. He grows corn. For 30 years he has sacrificed to devote himself his farmland in order to make it more productive.

Benito is confident that his business will continue to grow, because he has been doing his best to provide his hogs with proper nutrition. He hopes to make his hogs healthy upon reaching their optimum growth. With his determination to improve the family's living conditions and to provide his child with a higher level of education, he is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000. He will use the funds to purchase livestock feeds for his hog-raising business.This capital will eventually help him a lot, especially in improving his financial stability and improving his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feeds for his hog-raising business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yei. She sells at a food stall, and she has been in business for two years. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans to sell.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally is 39 years old. She is the mother of six children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been producing soybean milk for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day from their sales. Three of her children are employed. They earn about $10 per day. Phally is requesting a loan of $1300 to pay for her daughter’s passport expenses. This money will help her daughter to work in Thailand legally and earn more income to support the family. In the future, Phally would like to expand her business and help her children obtain higher education to get good jobs. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's passport expenses

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Yei. She sells at a food stall, and she has been in business for two years. She is 25 years old, married, and has one child, who is not in school. 

Esther heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans to sell.

loans.name: Sok Nim

texts.en: Sok Nim is 42 years old. She is the mother of four children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day. Her children are still in her care and in school. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sok Nim is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store from her home and help her children earn their bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Perisita

texts.en:
Perisita lives in Yei. She sells fish, and she has been in business for two years. She is 25 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are still in school. 

Perisita heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Sophear

texts.en: Sophear is 32 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in animal husbandry for more than two years and is successful in her career. She is involved in fattening up pigs and poultry. She earns about $7 per day. Her husband is truck driver who earns about $15 per day. Her children are still in her care and in school. Because their current truck is old, Sophear is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a new truck for her husband's delivery service. This purchase would enable her husband to attract more customers and earn more money to support the family. In the future, Sophear would like to purchase one more truck to run the service and to help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new truck for her husband to run his delivery service

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Yei. She sells fish, and she has been in business for two years. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are still in school. 

Betty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yei. She sells fish, and she has been in business for four years. She is 35 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 900 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang is 61 years old. She is the mother of three children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agriculture for more than twenty years and is successful in her career. She is grows rice and fattens up animals. She earns about $8 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. All of her children are employed. They earn about $13 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Neang is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase cattle for resale. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for resale

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en: Vanny is 33 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and her child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $7 per day. Due to the difficulty of her family’s transportation, Vanny is requesting a loan of $1300 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business, which is involved in animal husbandry, to earn extra income for the family and to send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en:
Ghadeer is a 25-year-old married mother of one son and two daughters; her husband is a worker earning a low salary which is insufficient to cover the family's costs and expenses.

Ghadeer's son requires immediate eye surgery lest he go blind, and so she is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her pay for his medical expenses. Treatment will allow him to live normally with the family.

Ghadeer is photographed in the picture with her husband and her children.

loans.use: to pay her son's medical expenses.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat is 58 years old. She is widowed and resides with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been selling rice and vegetables for more than five years, earning approximately $2 per day. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about $3 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Phat is requesting a loan of $800 to raise capital in her business to purchase more rice and vegetables for resale. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and build a new house to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business to purchase more rice and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 38-year-old man. He is married and a father to three sons and three daughters. All of his children are school students.

For the past twenty years, Bassam has been selling baked goods and different types of sweets. This has been a profitable project, but he also needs more support to cover the family's needs.

Bassam is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing new sweets templates and a new stove. Taking this loan will enable Bassam to improve the quality of his baked goods and sweets and to satisfy his customers. This will lead to an increase in production and so increase sales and improve the family's income.

Bassam is photographed in his bakery.

loans.use: to purchase new sweets templates and a new stove.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 42 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been selling fruit for more than seven years, earning approximately $8 per day. Her husband runs a taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about $5 per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $6 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Srey is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more fruits for resale. By doing so, she will earn more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits for resale.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 34-year-old man. He is married and the father of one son and three daughters. He is employed, but the salary he earns isn't enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past three years, Shadi has also been selling groceries. It has been a profitable project, but he needs more support to cover the costs of his business.

Shadi is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing necessary groceries currently missing from his inventory, such as canned food, milk, and rice. This loan will allow Shadi to offer a wide selection of groceries that his customers usually request and buy, which will increase his sales and improve the family's income.

Shadi is photographed in his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase necessary groceries to sell

loans.name: Sam Oun

texts.en: Sam Oun is 33 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a mechanic who earns about $10 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sam Oun is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase farmland for cultivating crops. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and help her child earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for cultivating crops

loans.name: Herminigildo

texts.en:
Herminigildo is a farmer who raises corn on his two hectares of field. He is 51 years old, married, and blessed with four children. According to him, only his youngest child went to college, and he is about to finish the coursework for his degree. His other two children are already working and helping him financially to provide the family's daily necessities.

Herminigildo is also raises hogs within his local community. He is a man full of hopes for his youngest child. He aims to develop his hog-raising business, but he has insufficient capital. For this reason, he is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy hog feed and vaccines. He hopes to earn a higher income and save some of it for the family's future emergencies. He hopes that his loan request will be granted.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey is a forty-six-year-old married man with six children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling bananas for ten years. He started with one acre and now has four acres. His business challenges are price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to hire employees to help expand the business. Geofrey is requesting this loan to buy bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en: Cissy is a 56-year-old hardworking lady who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a personal goal of educating her children. She has been in the cattle-selling business for the last five years. Her main hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock; however, she has a vision of expanding her business to new areas. She has applied for a loan to help her buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: To buy cattle to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Mayamou

texts.fr:
Née vers 1990, MAYAMOU vit avec ses 2 enfants et son époux dans une  famille traditionnelle élargie dans la commune rurale de SANANKOROBA. 
MAYAMOU s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa tante qui faisait le commerce d’articles divers. MAYAMOU, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour l’achat vente de céréales : niébé, mil, fonio, maïs, dah etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé les cinq prêts précédents, MAYAMOU est à son sixième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  100 sacs de grain de néré, auprès des paysans faisant la cueillette (à SANANKOROBA, Tiélé et Bancouman) et quelques rare fois avec les  grossistes de la place. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché de SANANKOROBA et à BAMAKO à une clientèle composée essentiellement de transformatrices de néré en Sounbala. 
MAYAMOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1990, Mayamou lives with her husband and her six children in an extended traditional family in the rural commune of Sanankoroba.

From a young age, Mayamou became interested in income-generating activities, and she learned her trade while working several years beside her aunt who was selling various goods.  She later chose to buy and sell grains such as niébé (cowpea), millet, fonio, maize, dah (seeds from the Roselle plant) etc.

Having duly repaid five previous loans, Mayamou is now on her sixth loan with Soro Yiriwaso.  She will use this loan to purchase 100 sacks of néré seeds from the villages of Sanankoroba, Tiélé and Bancouman where people pick néré fruits, and additionally, although much less frequently, from local wholesalers.  

She sells for cash and on credit, from her home, as well as at the Sanankoroba market and in Bamako, to a retail customer base which mostly consists of women who process néré fruits into Soumbala.

Mayamou is hoping to make a monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs which will be used to help her husband provide for the family, to repay her loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy néré seeds.

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Née  vers 1979 à SANANKOROBA, OUMOU vit avec ses 5 enfants et son époux dans une  famille monogame à SANANKOROBA. 
OUMOU n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite elle s’est intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa  grande sœur qui faisait les grillades : brochettes de bœuf avec du pain. OUMOU, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour  les mêmes les activités à savoir le petite restauration avec la préparation et vente de brochettes de boeuf, de sandwich, de l’atieké, etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé les deux prêts précédents, OUMOU est à son troisième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, de la viande des condiments pour sa préparation et de l’atieké. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, au marché de SANANKOROBA à une clientèle mixte. 
OUMOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1979 in Sanankoroba, Oumou lives with her five children and spouse in a monogamous family in Sanankoroba.

Oumou did not have the opportunity to attend school, she became interested early on in earning money by doing business along with her older sister  making "grillades": beef kebabs with bread.  Oumou, after years of experience with this, opted to start a similar business dealing mostly with small meals, preparing and selling beef kebabs, sandwiches, "attiéké" [dish made from cassava], etc.

After having propely repaid her two previous loans, Oumou is on her third loan with Soro Yiriwaso, which she will use to purchase meat and condiments for her food preparation and for making attiéké.  She buys locally and sells retail out of a market in Sanankoroba to a mixed clientele, both in cash and in credit.

Oumou would like to earn a monthly income of 60,000 FCFA, which will be used to help her husband take care of the needs of the family, pay back her loan, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for catering.

loans.name: Yoadi

texts.fr:
Née 1957  à TOMINIAN, YOADI vit avec ses 4 enfants dans sa  famille dans le quartier BELE de la ville de SANANKOROBA. 
Enseignante de profession,  YOADI s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente des habits en provenance du BURKINA FASO et des pagnes wax de Lomé (au Togo).    
Après avoir correctement remboursé les trois prêts précédents, YOADI est à son quatrième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  100 pièces de pagnes wax  auprès des  grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché de SANANKOROBA et dans les structures professionnelles de la place, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
YOADI espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1957 in Tominian, Yoadi lives with her four children and family in the Bele neighbourhood of the city of Sanankoroba.

A teacher by profession, Yoadi became interested in generating income primarily through the purchase and sale of outfits mostly from Burkina Faso, as well as Wax [a brand] pagnes from Lomé (in Togo).

After having properly repaid her three previous loans, Yoadi is on her fourth loan through Soro Yiriwaso, which she will use to purchase 100 articles of Wax pagnes from wholesalers.  She sells retail from home, the market in Sanankoroba, and in the professional buildings locally to a clientele of men and women.  She handles her sales in cash and credit.

Yoadi would like to earn a monthly income of 40,000 FCFA, which will be used for family needs, loan repayments, and as reinvestment in her business.

loans.use: to purchase pagnes.

loans.name: Ramata

texts.fr:
Née vers 1982 à Bamako, RAMATA vit avec ses 3 enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire dans la commune rurale de Ouelessebougou. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études,  très vite RAMATA s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus, son premier prêt a été bien remboursé et elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel destiné à la constitution de stock de condiments et denrées alimentaires pour la restauration. Elle s’approvisionne une fois par semaine à Bamako et compte avoir avec ce prêt, 60  kilogrammes de condiments, une tonne de céréales diverses et de tubercules pour servir pendant longtemps sans pénurie et espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75.000 FCFA pour rembourser les échéances du prêt et investir dans ses affaires.
Elle compte toujours sur l’appui financier de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’ouverture de nouvel restaurant en d’autre localité où le besoin se pose et aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités
texts.en:
Born around 1982 in Bamako, Ramata lives with her three children and her husband in a nuclear family in the rural commune of Ouelessebougou.

Not having had the chance to progress in her studies, Ramata got interested in income-generating activities at a young age.  Her first loan was duly repaid and she is now on her second individual loan, which will be used to constitute a stock of condiments and food supplies for her restaurant.  

Ramata buys her supplies once a week in Bamako and, with this loan, she is planning to purchase 60 kgs of condiments and 1,000 kgs of various grains and tubers, in order to be able to serve [her customers] for a long period of time without experiencing any shortage of food.  She is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 CFA francs, which will be used to invest in her business and to repay her loan according to the repayment schedule. 

Ramata is also counting on Soro Yiriwaso's financial support to open a new restaurant in a different locality, where this type of business is needed.  With financial assistance she will also support her husband in providing for the family; she will repay her loan and reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy food supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Fassoun

texts.fr:
Monsieur  FASSOUN  est âgé de 46 ans et vit avec ses 6 enfants et ses épouses dans une famille traditionnelle à FARABA, un des villages de la sous préfecture  Ouelessebougou, Région de Koulikoro.
FASSOUN n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales et autre article divers. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales et d’article divers. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son troisième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 2 tonnes de riz, 5 sacs de sucre et 2 cartons de thé, auprès des grossistes de BAMAKO qu’il revend en détail à FARABA, à crédit et au comptant a une clientèle mixte.
FASSOUN espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 100.000. FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Fassoun is 46 years old and lives with his six children and wives in a traditional family in Faraba, one of the villages of the sub-prefecture Ouelessebougou in the Region of Koulikoro.

Fassoun did not have the opportunity to attend school.  Early on, he became interested in working, most notably in the purchase and sale of cereals and other various items.  He learned about this trade from his maternal uncle, who was an important merchant of grains and misc. articles.  Faced with the challenge of satisfying his growing clientele, he decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso.  

He is on his third individual loan, which will be used to buy 2 tons of rice, 5 bags of sugar, and 2 cartons of tea from the wholesalers of Bamako, which he then sells retail in Faraba both in credit and cash to a mixed clientele. 

Fassoun hopes to earn a monthly income of 100,000 FCFA, which he will use to pay back the loan, while reinvesting the rest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 tons of rice, 5 bags of sugar, and 2 cartons of tea.

loans.name: Dzifa

texts.fr: Agée de 29ans et mère d’01 enfant de 02ans, Dzifa est mariée à un ingénieur. Elle est coiffeuse de profession. Pour rendre ses clients dans de bonnes conditions, elle a commencé par vendre des produits cosmétiques mèches, tissages, produits de beauté et autres dans son salon de coiffure ouvert en 2006. Elle exerce seule l’activité et est à son second crédit de WAGES. Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter des produits cosmétiques.  Elle veut épargner les profits, élargir l’activité et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
29 years old and the mother of two children, Dzifa is married to an engineer.  She is a professional hairstylist.  

In order to leave her clients in a good condition, Dzifa began selling cosmetic products such as highlights, weave, beauty products, and more in her hair salon that opened in 2006.  She does business on her own, and is on her second loan through WAGES.  This loan will allow her to buy cosmetic products.  She wants to save her profits, grow her business, and provide for her family's essential needs.

loans.use: to buy highlights, weave, and beauty products.

loans.name: Katiereton 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe   Katiereton 1sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 51 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Nimprodioula, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs, et Adama debout au milieu, sur la photo, 
 compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 4 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 600.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Katiereton 1 group are married men who average 51 years of age and 6 children each.  They all live in traditional families in Nimprodioula, a village in the Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali).

They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to bring their farming activities to a successful conclusion during the rainy season.  The crop that they are growing is maize.

Standing at the center, in the photo, Adama is planning to use his loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and also to pay for the cost of plowing on a 4-hectare land.

Production is sold at the village level, and, after the harvest, at the Sikasso market to a customer base which mostly consists of resellers from the big cities.

Adama is expecting average profits to reach 600,000 CFA francs per season. Profits will help him to repay his loan and to take care of his large family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds, and to pay for the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Katiereton 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe   Katiereton 2 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Nimprodioula, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.
