She normally gets the fish caught by her husband who goes fishing along Tonle Sap River every single day. Also, she buys fish from local fishermen and brings them to the market. 

From her business activities, she can earn in the neighborhood of USD $4 each day. Hin is now 52 years old and has five single children. 

Hin wants to get involved in a hog-raising business for extra income. However, due to the lack of capital she would like to acquire a loan of KHR 1,200,000 to purchase eight head of piglets and eight bags of feed for fattening them. This loan will provide Hin an opportunity to start up and work out her hog-raising business. She hopes that she will be able to make it more viable and profitable someday.

loans.use: to purchase eight head of piglets and eight bags of feed for fattening them.

loans.name: Hut

texts.en:
Hut is 39 years old, married, and has been residing together with her family in a peaceful village of Baray district. She is a good mother who is responsible for three single children enrolled in a local school. She and her husband, Pe, 49 years old, help each other in managing their rice farming business in order to provide the basic necessities, especially education, to their children. 

Hut said that she is just a low-educated woman who has encountered a lot of difficulties in life due to the lack of knowledge. And she doesn’t want her children to follow her path in life. She also believes that education is one of the best ways to alleviate poverty. 

With her first cycle loan she requested, she would like to purchase timber and wooden boards to fix and replace her wall. This will secure her family, who are often badly affected by the rain during the rainy season. She hopes to provide her family with comfortable living conditions. 

She is very happy and grateful for the support from all of you.

loans.use: to purchase timber and wooden boards to fix and replace her wall.

loans.name: Khak

texts.en:
Khak is 54 years old. She is the mother of three children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. 

She has been employed in a restaurant for more than a year, earning approximately $2 per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $6 per day. 

Khak wants to rebuild her present house. With this goal in mind, she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. By doing so, she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family. 

In the future, she would like to help her youngest child earn a Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Phorn is 43 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been running the business of growing rubber plants to sell for more than three years, earning approximately $17 per day. Her husband and her child are employed in the rubber plantation as well. They earn about $8 per day. Phorn is requesting a loan of $500 to hire farm workers to plant rubber trees to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to hire farm workers to plant rubber trees to sell

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary is 42 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a teacher who earns about $4 per day. One of her children is employed as a credit officer and earns about $5 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Nary is requesting a loan of $1,300 to purchase fodder for breeding pigs. By doing so, her pigs will gain weight faster. 

In the future, she would like to expand her pig farm and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for breeding pigs.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy is 38 years old. She is the mother of three children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in growing rice and breeding pigs to sell for more than two years, earning approximately $6 per day. Her husband is a chef who earns about $15 per day. Her children are still in her care and in school. 

In order to improve her business, Sophy is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland. This purchase will help her reduce farming expenses. 

In the future, she would like to expand her pig farm and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland.

loans.name: Kim Ang

texts.en:
Kim Ang is 33 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and a brother in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is an arc welder who earns about $10 per day. 

Kim Ang is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase construction tools for her brother to run the business as a construction foreman. By doing so, her brother would generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand the business and build a fence around her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools for her brother to run a business as a construction foreman.

loans.name: Bo

texts.en:
Bo is 45 years old. She is the mother of four children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than seven years, earning approximately $6 per day. Her husband runs a business of sound equipment rental. He earns about $4 per day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $7 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Bo is requesting a loan of $500 for her husband to purchase a motorbike to resell for a profitable price. By doing so, her husband would generate additional income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to help her husband purchase a motorbike to resell for a profitable price.

loans.name: Serey

texts.en: Serey is 45 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in the agricultural business for more than twenty years, has extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening up animals. She earns approximately $8 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $12 per day. Serey is requesting a loan of $1000 to pay for her son’s wedding ceremony expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to pay for her son's wedding ceremony expenses

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en: Sophorn is 38 years old. She is a mother of five children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in breeding pigs for more than twenty years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $6 per day. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $10 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sophorn is requesting a loan of $1300 to purchase more pigs to breed to resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would be able to earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs to breed to resell when they gain weight

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Yon is 57 years old. She is a mother of four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling traditional music instruments for more than ten years, earning approximately $16 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Three of her children are employed. They earn about $12 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Yon is requesting a loan of $1200 to raise capital in her business by purchasing more musical instruments to resell. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, Yon would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more musical instruments to resell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is married to a farmer and they live happily in a rural community planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. Since it is the major source of their income, Flora helps her husband manage their rice farming business to ensure a high production. They aim to increase their yields and income to continue sending their five children to school so that they will earn degrees and find good jobs someday. 

Due to inadequate capital, Flora is asking for an additional loan of P15,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and pay for expenses incurred in transplanting rice seedlings. Through patience and hard work, they believe that they can improve their farming business and they hope that they will have a fruitful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and pay for expenses incurred in transplanting rice seedlings

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long is 31 years old and a married woman who is responsible for two school-aged children. She lives in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Long operates two businesses: a farming business and a sewing business. Long usually manages her rice farming during the rainy season and she works in Phnom Penh sewing clothes during the dry season. With her experiences in rice husbandry, Long works tirelessly from dawn to dusk in the rice field to ensure a high production. 

And now, in the early rainy season, Long would like to obtain a loan of KHR 800,000 to pay for labor costs for plowing her rice fields and to purchase seeds to sow in her soil. She hopes that this will improve her farming business and she will have a fruitful harvest in the coming season.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs for plowing her rice fields and to purchase seeds

loans.name: Rizalde

texts.en:
Rizalde Sr. is a father who owns and manages a corn farming business in the community. He is 51 years old and has four grown-up children. As a responsible father, he aimed to improve their corn farming business to increase his income to be able to satisfy his family's needs and support the education of his children. Despite financial difficulty, he has the determination to uplift their status of living and give his family a better life.

To improve his farming business, he is asking for an additional capital of P30,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay for expenses incurred in planting corn. He mentioned that this loan will help him to improve his farming business and he hopes that he will increase his yields and income this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay for expenses incurred in planting corn

loans.name: Marine

texts.en: Marine lives in Kapan town, in the south of Armenia, together with her husband. Marine works at a local factory and her husband works at the local electrical station. About 8 years ago the couple bought a few beehives and started breeding the bees. Currently, the number of beehives in their farm has reached 16. Marine wants to purchase more bees and beehives to keep them. In order to implement this goal Marine has applied for this loan. With the increased number of beehives, Marine will gather more honey, which she sells in Kapan. This means additional income and a new perspective for the development of beekeeping for Marine and her husband.

loans.use: to pay for bees and beehives

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en: Enhtuya is a 38-year-old single woman who lives with her siblings in Selenge province in Northern Mongolia. She started her sewing business in 2004, which is right after she got her certification in sewing. She sews a variety of garments. Her sewing skills are well-known around the neighborhood. She has a few contracted customers and she sews their uniforms. However, since she started the business, she never got a chance to renew her equipment or maintain her house. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who is planning to expand her business in the future. She's requesting 1,000,000 MNT to renew her equipment and maintain her house.

loans.use: to renew her equipment and maintain her house

loans.name: Raen

texts.en: Raen is 29 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been running a sewing shop for more than two years, earning approximately $10 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $7 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Raen is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase more cloth to sew more clothes to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelors degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to sew more clothes to sell

loans.name: Zhasmen

texts.en:
Zhasmen lives in Khndzoresk village with her husband and son. The main source of income for the family is agriculture: cattle breeding and land cultivation. Zhasmen uses the main part of the income to cover the family's household costs, which doesn't allow her to make savings to invest in agriculture. Zhasmen uses special techniques to cultivate the land, and she needs to purchase fuel to continue the land cultivation. She also wants to purchase forage to feed the cattle and keep stable development of the cattle breeding. 

This loan is important for Zhasmen to purchase necessary fuel and forage. This ensures a stable income for her during the year, and will help her to ensure her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to pay for fuel and forage

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en: Tsetsegmaa is 48 years old and lives with her son's family in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. Her son and his wife are both employed. She started her mobile food-selling business in 2000. She cooks her own food and sells it at the train station. Her food is delicious and her kitchen is surprisingly clean. Her customers' satisfaction is good, however, the raw materials are getting too expensive. Therefore, she's requesting 950,000 MNT to purchase meat from local herders, which will save her money. She will use half of the meat for her food business and rest she will sell. She's a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "If I couldn't get my raw materials cheap, I could lose my business."

loans.use: to purchase meat from local herders to sell

loans.name: Kasuku Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her mid-30s, is married with two children in school  She has been running two businesses, fish sales and clothes sales, for ten years now.  She works from 8.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to start selling clothes, increase her fish stock, and pay household expenses and has paid back her loan successfully. She wants a loan to buy more fish and more clothes to resell.  Her dream is to one day be able to own a big clothing shop.

Halima will share this loan with her loan group "Kasuku" which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fish and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Tseinpil

texts.en: Tseinpil is 53 years old and lives with her three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her eldest two children are employed, and the younger one is a student. She started her used clothes shop in 2010 by renting a counter at the market. She handpicks her products. Her income has been relatively the same since she opened her shop. Therefore, she found a bigger place to sell her clothes. She has already rented the place. Since the place is much bigger, she needs to increase her supplies in order to run her business. Therefore, she's requesting 1,500,000 MNT to do so.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to run her business well

loans.name: Mawenzi Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her early 30s, is married and has two children who attend school. She has been running a business making and selling Batiki (tie-dye) for ten years. She works from 6.00 a.m. to 5.30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Halima's 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy missing items for her Batiki business and a big radio and she has repaid all her loans successfully. Halima wants a loan to buy a roll of material and Batiki equipment. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Halima will share this loan with her loan group "Mawenzi" which consists of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy a roll of material and Batiki equipment.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag, 52 years old, lives in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband passed away recently and her children live separately. Tungalag started her cosmetics retail business in 2003 by renting a counter in the market. Over the years, she gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. Her location is good and her products are all well qualified.

Tungalag is a pharmacist; therefore, she provides advice to her customers. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my customers are increasing rapidly, I have expanded my shop and I need additional resources in order to run the business efficiently." Tungalag is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more cosmetics.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Chanthol, 24 years old, is the mother of two children. She resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Chanthol has been selling palm juice and fattening up cattle for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $3 per day.

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Chanthol is requesting a loan of $1,100 to purchase farmland for cultivating rice. This purchase would enable her to generate more income to support the family. In the future, Chanthol would like to expand her business and help her children earn their Bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchasae farmland for cultivating rice

loans.name: Narong

texts.en:
Narong, 45 years old, is the father of five children. He resides with his wife in Battambang Province, Cambodia. Narong has been running a taxi service (motor taxi) for more than two years, earning approximately $8 per day. His wife is a rice farmer who earns about $2 per day. One of her children is a construction worker who earns about $3 per day.

Because his current motorbike is old, Narong is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a new motorbike to run his taxi service. This purchase would enable him to attract more customers and earn more income to support the family. In the future, Narong would like to expand his business and help his children earn their Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, he hopes to rebuild his house to make it more comfortable for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for his taxi service

loans.name: Solongo

texts.en: Solongo, 27 years old, lives with her parents and sister in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Selenge province, Mongolia. She started her business selling used shoes in 2006. Solongo handpicks her products. Her shop location is excellent and it is well known around the neighborhood. Now that summer is approaching, Solongo needs to buy summer products. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy shoes for the summer. Solongo is a sharp young woman who says, "Since I'm the only one with income in the family, I have to make the best of it in order to support my family."

loans.use: To buy shoes for the summer

loans.name: Chak Riya

texts.en: Chak Riya, 23 years old, is married and resides with her mother, her husband and one child in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has been working as a tailor for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a blacksmith who earns about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Chak Riya is requesting a loan of $900 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine lives in Yerevan with her son, a taxi driver. He also helps Karine run the shop, which they established a year ago. Karine sells household goods. During the past year, Karine has formed a good client base, and now wants to increase the variety of inventory to keep her shop competitive. This loan will help Karine to purchase more inventory and increase her sales. Karine will get additional income, which she plans to invest in creating better conditions in her shop and expanding it in the future.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of household goods

loans.name: Tsolmon

texts.en:
Tsolmon, 45 years old, lives with her husband and two children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband works at a construction site, her older child helps with the business and her younger one is a college student.

Tsolmon operates a garment and home product sales business. She started her business in 2006 by renting a counter in the market. Her shop location is excellent and she has great taste in garments. Tsolmon's products are elegant and relatively affordable. Over the years, she has gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. Tsolmon is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy more summer garments to make more profits to save money for her daughter's wedding.

loans.use: To buy more summer garments

loans.name: Ieng

texts.en:
Ieng, 37 years old, is married and has two school-aged children. She lives and farms in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Ieng mainly grows rice crops on her existing farmland, generating an average income of US $1.50 per day. She has been involved in this type of business for nearly twelve years.  Every harvesting season, Ieng always has her husband and children help manage the business efficiently.

Ieng has requested this KHR 1,600,000 loan to rent a plot of farmland, on which she will transplant her rice crops. She feels very happy to receive the loan from our lenders and she hopes to further improve her farming business by using this fund.

loans.use: to rent a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta, 52 years old, lives in Yerevan with her son, a house decorator. For the past ten years, Marieta has sold granular coffee, using special equipment, to also mill the coffee. Marieta has been operating the business successfully, which was important to her in order to raise her son and cover the family's daily expenses.

Marieta has applied for this loan because she now wants to expand her business by purchasing and selling more coffee. She wants to earn more income and support her son to start a family. Development of the business is important for her to reach this goal.

loans.use: to buy more coffee

loans.name: Sok Kea

texts.en:
Sok Kea, 28 years old, is the mother of two children. She resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Sok Kea has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than five years. She also weaves palm thatches to sell when she is free from her farm work. She earns approximately $4 per day. Her husband runs a motor taxi service, earning about $3 per day.

Since the current motorbike is old, Sok Kea is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run his taxi service. This purchase would enable him to attract more customers and earn more income to support the family. In the future, Sok Kea would like to expand her business and help her children earn their Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband's taxi service

loans.name: Not

texts.en:
Not, who is 40 years old, is a resident of Baray. He dedicates himself to rice husbandry alongside his lovely wife. Farming is their main source of income, and it allows them to raise their children. He thanks his business, because it provides his family with enough food and for their basic needs. Not has five children, and recently two of them gained employment as garment factory workers. The remaining three are still attending a local public school.

Due to his financial constraints, Not decided to acquire a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to purchase timber and wooden boards to finish building his house, which is under construction. After his house will be completely constructed, he and his family hope to live in a comfortable house. In the future, he would like to purchase extra land to expand his rice production as well as his household income. He wishes to be a successful entrepreneur in his career in years to come.

loans.use: To purchase timber and wooden boards to finish building his house

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is 23. She lives in Spandarian village with her husband and little son. The couple runs a farm, where they raise livestock and cultivate land. Their main source of income comes from the sales of their harvest (potato and barley) and meat of their livestock. 

Armine has applied for this loan, as she needs investments for land cultivation and cattle breeding. With the loan's help she plans to purchase three cows. She plans to feed, raise, and sell the meat at the end of the year when this product is in-demand the most. Armine also wants to purchase potato and barley seeds, fertilizer, and fuel to start and organize the land cultivation. 

This loan is important for the young family to continue their stable development of the farm, which will provide them with a prosperous life and secure a better future for their children.

loans.use: To pay for livestock, potato seeds, barley seeds, fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en: Sitha is 27 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than six years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day. Additionally, he is a rice farmer. In order to improve her farming work, Sitha is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and help send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en: Tha is 32 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs an electronic repair shop. He earns about $5 per day. In order to improve her husband’s business, Tha is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase electronic spare parts to repair and resell for clients. In this way, Tha's husband would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and help her children earn bachelors' degrees.

loans.use: to purchase electronic spare parts to repair and resell for clients.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en: Frida is 49. She lives with her husband and son. The family has been involved in agriculture for 18 years. Frida has applied for this loan to develop cattle breeding. She plans to purchase 3 cows. This will allow Frida to receive more meat and milk, the sales of which she will earn most of the family's income. Frida is very excited to expand the farm, which will provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to pay for 3 cows.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 23 years old. He is single and lives with four family members, three of whom work.

Ibrahim has owned a women's clothing shop since 2010, selling clothing and accessories. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3000 youth loan in order to add more goods to his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to add more goods to his shop.

loans.name: Channoeurn

texts.en: Channoeurn is 57 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in producing furniture for more than a year, earning approximately $15 per day. All of her children are employed. They earn about $14 per day. Due to the difficulty of her family’s transportation, Channoeurn is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married, and has two children.

Hani is a grocer; in 2009 he opened his own shop selling all kinds of fruits and vegetables. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3000 loan in order to fix his shop’s floors and to install an outdoor ceiling. He is aiming to earn more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to fix his shop’s floors and to install an outdoor ceiling.

loans.name: Haykush

texts.en: Haykush lives in Lehvaz village with her husband and son. The family is involved in agriculture. The current income Haykush gets is barely enough to meet the family's needs, and she needs sufficient funds to invest in agriculture. Haykush has applied for this loan to purchase 2 cows and a heifer. This will allow her to continue breeding the cattle and increase thier number further. Haykush hopes to earn more income and create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for 2 cows and a heifer.

loans.name: Tersa

texts.en: Tersa is a married woman with three children. She lives in the town of Antequera, Bohol with her family. Her main livelihood is hog-raising, which helps support her family. She requested this loan to purchase pig feeds and vitamins. Tersa hopes to generate more income and be able to sustain her family, especially her childrens' educations.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 48 years old and a married father of six children living in Hioma, Uganda. 

Erick owns a produce business and has been in business for 10 years. He faces challenges of price fluctuations and high fuel costs. His family goal is to educate his children and build a permanent house, while his business dream is to expand his business to new markets and move his business to a more permanent location. Erick intends to use the loan facility to buy maize to resell.

loans.use: to buy maize to resell.

loans.name: Tweheyo Humya Women Group

texts.en:
Pasika is a 22-year-old businesswoman, married with one child, and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  She has been selling rice for four years and received the initial capital from the savings she earned while she was still a food vendor.  Price fluctuations, inflation, and inadequate capital to purchase stock are the major problems she faces.

However, her personal goal is to educate her child and her business goal is to move the business to a more permanent location.  Pasika wants a loan to buy rice for selling.  She is a member of the above-mentioned group, and as per group policy, each member guarantees the other access to a loan.

loans.use: to buy rice for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows for rearing.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 26-year-old married woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda.She has been selling timber for one year. Her hardships are high fuel and transportation costs. Her personal goal is educating her children and her business goal is buying land to grow crops. Susan intends to use the money to buy timber to sell.

loans.use: to buy timber to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a 44-year-old single mother of six children living in Kasese, Uganda.The responsibility of taking care of the family solely rests on her. She has been selling cassava for ten years and this has helped her to educate her children. Her hardships are high fuel and transportation costs. Her personal goal is educating her children and her business goal is expanding her business into new markets. Fatuma wants money to buy cassava to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is hardworking man living in Hoima, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for 5 years. He started as a motorcycle rider while saving to set up a shop. He faces the challenges of high fuel and transport costs coupled with inadequate capital to meet the high demand. 
His family goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to buy land for crop growing. He also wants to move his business to a more permanent location. James intends to use the loan to buy salt, sugar and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Julius Robert

texts.en: Julius, a 26-year-old married man with three children, lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He rides a motorcycle for business and bought it from his savings of cocoa sales. Mechanical breakdowns are the main hardships he is facing, especially during this rainy season since most of the roads are impassable. His personal goal is to see his children educated up to the university. The purpose of this loan is to buy another motorcycle for business.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for the business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah a 37-year-old hardworking lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her personal goal is to build a permanent house. She has been in the restaurant business for the last two years after after using savings she earned through her salary as a teacher. Her main hardship is customers not paying on time; however, she has a vision of moving her business to a more permanent location and having a modern hotel in town. Sarah needs this loan to buy food such as rice and bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy food such as rice and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Tedison

texts.en:
Tedison is a 39-year-old businessman who is married with 5 children and living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He owns a retail shop and has been in the business for ten years. He started this business from proceeds of his cocoa-growing business. Price fluctuations, customers not paying on time, theft, and inadequate capital to purchase stock are the main hardships he faces.
He has a mission to educate his children through higher institutions and build a permanent house for residence. His business goals are hiring employees to help expand the business and expanding the business into new markets. The purpose of this loan is to buy shop items such as salt, sugar, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy shop items such as salt, sugar, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a hardworking married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda with a personal goal of educating his children through college. He has been in the transport business for the past year. He earned the money to invest in a motorcycle from plumbing and electrician work. He faces hardships such as the rainy season, which limits movement of customers; however, he has a vision of buying a car to ease his movement despite the weather changes. Samuel needs a loan to buy another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Everly

texts.en:
Everly is a 42-year-old fish dealer who is married with six children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda.
He started his business from the money he saved from his agricultural produce sales. Taxes, inadequate capital, theft, and price fluctuations are the main hardships he is facing. However, his personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house for residence.
His business goals are to diversify his business and start farming, hire employees to help him expand his business, and buy a refrigerator. The purpose of this loan is to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys a 59-year-old married lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a personal goal of educating her children so they will earn degrees as minimum qualification. She has been running a retail shop for the last ten years after getting capital from her husband. She is facing financial hardship because of customers not paying on time and because of price fluctuations. However, she has a dream of owning a wholesale shop in the next three years. Gladys needs a loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 30-year-old business man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a bar and he got start up capital from the sale of his cocoa harvest. Inadequate capital and price fluctuation affect his business.

His personal goals are to buy a car, educate his children and build a permanent house for residence. His business goals are expanding the business to new markets, moving the business to a more permanent location and modernizing his bar. The purpose of the loan is to buy beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer to sell

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey owns a livestock business. He has sufficient experience in running this kind of business. He is thankful because his wife is supportive in making his business more profitable.

Rey has been blessed with six children and all of them are studying. Through the income generated from his livestock and corn field business he is able to provide his family's needs. His main goal is to send his children to a higher level of education and have a better way of living.

Rey is asking for a loan amounting to 40,000 PHP to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines to maintain good growth of his raised hogs. He hopes that this amount will enable him to obtain success in life.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines to maintain good growth of his raised hogs

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Due to the hardship of living, Romeo aimed to improve his status of living and become financially stable before he is going to settle down. He is 31 years old and still single. He owns and manages a corn farming business to earn a living. He has been a farmer for almost four years and usually earns a profit of 15,000 PHP in every harvest season.

He utilized his income to satisfy their necessities and finance the education of his younger brother.  He planned to expand his corn plantation to ensure a high production, but due to insufficient capital, he is requesting an additional 15,000 PHP to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in corn farming.

Despite problems and calamities he has encountered in life, he believes that he will be able to improve his farming business and is hoping that he will be having a good production.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in corn farming

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a twenty-eight year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of building a permanent house for residence as he is currently renting. He has been a motorcyclist for the last four years and rides to earn a living.

His main hardship is high fuel costs, however he has a vision of buying land to grow crops and expanding his business to new markets. William needs a loan to buy construction materials for his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is 31. She lives in Meghri town with her husband and two daughters. Kristine works at the local meteorological station as an operator. Her husband is a police officer. Also, Kristine and her husband run a farm where they breed pigs. They have been running the farm for 2 years, through which they managed to build a barn and create all necessary conditions for its development.

Kristine has applied for this loan increase the number of pigs in her farm. She also wants to purchase forage to feed them. Development of pig breeding is important for Kristine and her husband to have a stable source of income and ensure a better life for their children.

loans.use: to pay for pigs and forage.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is a responsible housewife who is engages in a hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She is 32 years old and has three school-age children. Due to financial difficulty, she aims to improve her hog-raising business to earn a sufficient income and satisfy her family's necessities and support the schooling of her children. She has been in this business for almost 6 years and usually earns a profit of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) that she usually spends for the food, clothing, and allowances of her children. 

Anabel aims to raise more pigs to sell in the future, but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional 10,000 PHP to buy feeds, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. She believes that someday, she will improve the business and make it viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope is a married lady with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been operating a retail shop for the last eight years. She faces hardships of price fluctuation and inflation, which limit her net profits. However, she has a vision of expanding her business to new markets and owning a wholesale shop. Hope intends to use the loan facility to buy general merchandise, such as soap and cooking oil, to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as soap and cooking oil, to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie supports her family through raising hogs. She is currently raising five hogs to be fattened. She aims to provide them a proper nutrition to be able to obtain greater profits. Melanie has been in this kind of business for one year. Aside from raising of hogs, she also engages in a farming business, particularly planting and harvesting rice crops. She is really thankful and blessed because she is able to support her husband in performing farm activities.

The couple were blessed with two children who go to school. Melanie plans to buy livestock feed and vaccines, but her income is not sufficient due to her expenses in her farming business. With regards to this matter, she is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She would be glad if this amount of loan is approved because it would allow her to obtain better profits to sustain her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and vaccines for the hogs she raises.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 56-year-old business man. He is married with eight children living Bundibugyo, Uganda.

Moses owns a retail shop, which he bought from money he got after selling his maize garden. Customers not paying on time, inadequate capital, and price fluctuations are his major hardships. Educating his children and building a permanent house are his personal goals.

His business goals are to venture into commercial farming so as to earn extra income and expand the business into new markets. Moses wants a loan to buy stock such as sausage, sugar, and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock such as sausage, sugar, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Appolo

texts.en: Appolo is a 31-year-old married man with one child. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of building a permanent house for his residence. The responsibility of taking care of his family solely rests on him, and his desire is to educate his child up to a university level. He has been running a computer business for the last six years, after getting family contributions. He has a hardship of having an unpredictable electric supply; however, he has a vision of expanding his business to new markets and buying a generator. Appolo needs a loan to buy a generator.

loans.use: To buy a generator

loans.name: Husein

texts.en: Husein is a 27-year-old business man. He is married with two children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a studio that he compliments with a small retail shop. He started his business from his small savings and has been in this business for two years. Finding customers, encountering price fluctuations, and having inadequate capital to buy digital cameras are the main problems that he is facing. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house. His business goals are to move his business to a more permanent location and buy modern digital equipment. The purpose of the loan is to buy a machine for printing photos of his clients.

loans.use: To buy a new machine to print photos of his clients

loans.name: Asuman

texts.en:
Asuman is a 40-year-old business man.  He is married with four children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  He has a wholesale shop and has been in business for sixteen years.  He generated his initial capital from selling cocoa.

Price fluctuations greatly affect his net profits.  His business plan is to expand into new markets, and his personal goal is to educate his children up to a university level. Asuman needs a loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: To buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell

loans.name: Marsela

texts.en:
Marsela lives in Kapan with her family: her husband and three sons. A few months ago the family started their own business of selling construction materials. During this short period of time, the shop has gained a loyal and ever-growing customer base, which allows Marsela to plan her business' expansion and increase its inventory variety. Marsela is asking for a loan to purchase more construction materials. This will help her to increase her sales and have more income. 

The development of her business is vital for Marsela and her sons to have a better quality of life currently and in the future.

loans.use: To pay for construction materials

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 62-year-old business man. He is married with five children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for twelve years, and he got his start-up capital from his salary earnings as a social worker. Customers not paying on time, inadequate capital to purchase stock, and price fluctuations are the main hardships he is facing. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house for his family.
Moving his business to a more permanent location and expanding his business into a new market are his business goals. Samuel intends to use the loan to pay tuition for his child, who is attending a university, and buy sugar to sell.

loans.use: To pay tuition for his child and buy sugar to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, a 34-year-old businessman and married father of two children, lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda where he has a retail shop that he began with profits earned from cocoa selling. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are the main hardships he faces.

Robert is requesting a loan to buy plastic chairs and sugar to sell. His dream is to educate his children to the university level, and his business plan is to buy land and grow crops for sale.

loans.use: to buy  merchandise such as sugar and plastic chairs to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 33-year-old married mother of three children living in Hioma, Uganda. Employed by the local government, Margret is a teacher by profession who is very passionate about her job because she loves working with young people.

Margret faces challenges such as hyper inflation in these hard economic times. Because her business goal is to become a farmer, she is requesting this loan to buy land for farming. Her family goal is to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en: Syuzanna lives in Kapan town with her husband, son, and daughter. The main source of income for the family is the little grocery store. The couple has been running the grocery for 11 months. Now Syuzanna wants to increase the variety of products they sell to attract more clients and stay competitive. This loan will help her to purchase food and drinks for the grocery and increase sales. Syuzanna will get additional income, which is important for her to save and invest in further development of the business.

loans.use: to pay for food and drinks for the grocery

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 31 years old, married and living in Hioma, Uganda. He is a teacher by profession and he says that he is living his dream as he has always wanted to mentor the youth. He faces challenges of high price fluctuations and he finds it hard to minimally provide basics to his family since he earns very little salary. His goal is to educate his children up to the University level and renovate his residential house. David intends to use the loan facility to renovate his house.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Emilya

texts.en: Emilya lives in Kapan with her husband. She is involved in retail. Emilya rents a booth in the city market where she trades clothing and shoes. Emilya would like to add a new variety of clothing and shoes for the summer season.  Therefore, she needs sufficient funds. This loan will help Emilya to purchase clothing and shoes for men and women. A larger stock with more variety will help Emilya to attract more clients and develop her business.

loans.use: to pay for clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Saad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has three children.

Saad has owned a workshop since 2008, repairing cars. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2400 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to install a light box. He is aiming to gain more profits that will offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to install a light box.

loans.name: Nathaly Jeanne's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux personnes. La représentante du groupe du nom de Nathaly Jeanne est âgée de 44 ans. Nathaly Jeanne est mariée et mère de trois enfants avec cinq personnes à charge dont cinq sont scolarisés.  Elle est a un niveau d'instruction secondaire. Pour supporter les charges quotidiennes, elle mène comme activité la vente d'oignons et de tomates depuis trois ans. Nathaly Jeanne s'approvisionne dans les marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de combler les attentes de sa clientèle, elle a sollicité et a obtenu, ensemble avec sa coéquipière, un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Nathaly Jeanne se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
This group is composed of two persons. The group's representative, Nathaly Jeanne, is 44 years old. She is married and a mother of three children. She has five persons to support, of whom five are in school. She has a middle school education. 

To cover her everyday expenses, she has had a business selling onions and tomatoes for three years. She gets her supplies from markets in Benin. 

With the goal of fulfilling the expectations of her customers, Nathaly Jeanne requested and obtained, along with her team members, a micro-loan from Finadev. 

Nathaly Jeanne is found at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy four baskets of onions and three baskets of tomatoes

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has four children.

Ahmad has owned a food market since 2012 selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fishes, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about each customer's needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2400 loan in order to purchase two fridges, an electrical generator and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide his family the opportunity for a better life as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase two fridges, an electrical generator and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Akouélé's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux personnes. La représentante du groupe du nom d'Akouélé est âgée de 46 ans. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants scolarisés, Akouélé a cinq personnes à charge dont un est aussi scolarisé. Elle est une illettrée. Pour supporter les charges quotidiennes, elle mène comme activité la vente des boîtes de conserve, du riz, du gari, du yaourt, des boissons en cannette et en plastique et d'autres articles depuis 14 ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés du Bénin. Afin d'augmenter son capital, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Akouélé se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
This group is composed of two persons. The group's representative, Akouélé, is 46 years old, married, and a mother of four children in school. She has five persons to support, including one who is also in school. 

Akouélé  is illiterate. To cover her day-to-day expenses, she has had a business selling canned foods, rice, gari (cassava couscous), yogurt, beverages in cans or plastic bottles, and other items, for fourteen years. She gets her supplies from markets in Benin. 

To increase her capital, she requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev. 

Akouélé is found at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy two boxes of canned food, ten 1-kg sacks of rice, a sack of gari (cassava couscous), 20 pots of yogurt of various sorts, 10 boxes of beverages in cans or plastic bottles.

loans.name: Sajed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married and has five children.

Sajed has owned a shop since 2011 for selling, filtering and mobilizing water. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $1800 loan in order to purchase an electrical generator. He is aiming to gain more profits that will offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 32. She lives in Artashat town with her mother and daughter. Anna's mother is 52 and works at one of the local banks as a cashier. Anna's daughter is 11, she goes to school. 
Three years ago this young and enterprising woman, Anna, started her business. She started running a shop, where she sells souvenirs,  cosmetics and household goods. The shop is located in the center of the town. 
Anna has applied for this loan to purchase more inventory (souvenirs, cosmetics and household goods) for her shop. This will allow her to increase her sales and have more income. Anna wants to provide all the necessary conditions for her mother and daughter. Development of the business is important for her to reach this goal.

loans.use: to pay for souvenirs, cosmetics and household goods.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is a young entrepreneur from Goris town, Armenia. Two years ago he started his business by providing car wheel repair services. Artur successfully manages and organizes the business.  As a result he has a loyal customer base. 
Artur wants to provide services with better quality to his clients. For this aim he needs to purchase special equipment, which will allow him to do repairs with better quality. It is important for Artur to develop his business and have more income. Artur lives with his wife, mother and little child. Additional income is important for the young family to have a better quality of life and hope for a better future.

loans.use: to pay for equipment to repair car wheels.

loans.name: Hope To God-Ii Group

texts.en:
These are small scale businesswomen in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to seek a loan of 500,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each to be able to expand their businesses. With a loan of 500,000.00 SLL, they will be able to add more stocks in their businesses, make more sales, and make more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, feed and clothe them. 

Aminata is the leader of this group. She was born in a place call Mamusa, in southern Sierra Leone. She is forty-five years of age. Aminata is married and has five children. Her husband is an NGO worker and her children are attending primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. 

Aminata sells cold drinks. She has been doing this business for many years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying crates of soft drinks, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy crates of soft drinks, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Work Hard Group

texts.en:
Haja is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Haja was born in Makeni city, about thirty six years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has two children: one is attending primary school and the other is in secondary school. 

For eight years now, Haja has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. This is the first loan that Haja and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Haja will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to expand her business. She will buy palm-oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc. at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc. at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Tankesu Group

texts.en:
Yainken is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Yainken was born in Port Loko town, in northern Sierra Leone. She is forty-two years old. She is married to a trader and the couple has six children who are attending primary, secondary and tertiary institution. Yainken sells palm-oil (wine tapped from palm-trees) and has been doing this business for twenty years now.

With the help of this loan, Yainken and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Yainken will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy gallons of palm-oil to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm-oil to add to her business

loans.name: Women Progress Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Women Progress” group from Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Marion is the leader of this group. The thirty-eight-year-old is married to a trader and they have three children. Marion has been a businesswoman for twelve years now.  She sells “Bamako” cloths (cloths made in Mali). With her share of this loan, she will buy Bamako cloths at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy Bamako cloths at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Masiyaday Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Masiyaday” group. They are small scale businesspeople based in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mohamed. Mohamed is age thirty-eight.  He was born in Lunsar town where he is currently residing with his wife and three children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary school and secondary school. For many years now, Mohamed has been selling palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil). With this loan, he will buy palm-oil at wholesale to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil at wholesale to add to his business

loans.name: Unity Women Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Unity Women” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of 3,300,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for the entire group. 

Adama is the leader of this group. Adama is forty-one-years old. She is married and has four children – two in primary school and two in secondary school. Adama sells onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, tomatoes, etc. With the help of this loan, Adama will invest in her business by buying onions, margi, salt, pepper, tomatoes, etc., in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy onions, margi, salt, pepper, tomatoes, etc., in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Coka Group

texts.en: Sauda, who is in her early 50's, is married and has three children.  One of them goes to school.  She has several businesses: selling charcoal, running a retail shop and a grocery. She has had her businesses since 2006.  She works from 6.00 am to 10.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and more beers, sodas, sugar, wheat flour, cooking oil and small items in the shop, like sweets, etc.

loans.name: Ulongoni Group

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi, who is in her early 50's, is a widow with one grownup child and five granddaughters, four of whom go to school.  She has been selling vegetables for eleven years now.  She works from 5:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, with which she wants to buy more vegetables to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to start selling second-hand clothes with her loan group.  She will share this loan with her loan group "Ulongoni", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bendicion De Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.en:
Odalis is the coordinator of her group, Bendicion De Mujeres Trabajadoras (Blessing of working women), located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. Odalis says that her most important challenge is to work hard to provide for her family all the things that her partner cannot.

The owner of a miscellaneous sales business, Odalis sells shoes, cosmetics, clothing, and other merchandise. She is excited to be requesting her fourth loan from Esperanza which she will invest in her business by increasing her inventory through the purchase of more merchandise.

Odalis, who wants to have a successful business, plans to open a miscellaneous products store and purchase her own home to further provide for her family's needs. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics and beauty products.

loans.name: Fuerza Divina 5 Group

texts.en:
Yuberkis is the coordinator of her group Fuerza Divina (divine force) 5. This group is located in Hato Mayor, a rural town where the economy is based around agriculture. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. She is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She runs a business selling food.

Yuberkis started her business with the first loan she received from Esperanza. She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, flour, canned food, and other goods. She tells us that her biggest challenge has been to build her house. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business, she wants to have a successful grocery store or Colmado (as we call it).  When she starts to receive a better income, she will build her house and help her long-term partner with expenses. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, flour, canned food, etc.

loans.name: Reinaldo Manuel

texts.es: Reinaldo de 21 años de edad tiene un estudio de grabación  y ha sacado música al mercado, entre ellos varios sencillos; pero además él  es un comerciante que se dedica a la venta de artículos variados, que distribuye entre sus clientes, mediante pedidos y estos le pagan en plazos que pactan con él. La música es una parte muy importante en la vida de Reinaldo. Lo hace ver la vida de una forma diferente y lo ha ayudado en su madurez; por eso  está apoyando a jóvenes que sueñan con ser músicos y él es consciente que sentirla, los aparta de muchos males de la sociedad. Su meta mas adelante es tener un estudio de grabación, para poder ayudar a las personas que están iniciando su vida musical y perfeccionarse cada día más. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará un micrófono, una consola y un equipo de grabación; así mismo comprará mercancía variada para responder a pedidos de ropa y accesorios femeninos que han hecho sus mejores clientes y el los complacerá para fidelizarlos cada vez mas.  Su credikiva supone una inversión de éxito porque aumentará las posibilidades de editar con calidad y porque en su experiencia comercial vende a crédito solo a clientes que pagan efectivamente.
texts.en: Reinaldo is 21 years old; he has a recording studio and has sold music including some singles. He is also a salesman and sells various products to his customers who give him orders and pay him by quotas that they set up with him. Music is a very important part of Reinaldo’s life; it makes him see life differently and has helped him mature. This is why he is supporting other young people who dream about being musicians and believes that feeling the music helps many stay away from some of society’s bad influences. Reinaldo’s greatest wish is to have a recording studio to help people who are starting out musically and to each day improve his life and self. At present, he needs a credikiva that will be used to buy a microphone, a control panel and recording equipment as well as merchandize to meet his customers’ orders of clothing and women’s accessories that have been made by his best customers; this will help him gain their loyalty even more. Reinaldo believes that this credikiva is an investment to his success because it will increase the possibilities for him to edit quality work and his commercial experience has taught him to sell only to customers who pay effectively.

loans.use: buy a microphone, a control panel and recording equipment as well as various merchandize including clothing and women’s accessories.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Ra is 48 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up pigs for more than 20 years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is employed in the government. He earns about $3 per day. Two of her children are employed in garment factory. They earn about $5 per day.

In order to improve her family’s finance, Ra is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her husband to run the taxi service. This purchase will enable her husband to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree. Also, she plans to build a fence around her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her husband to run the taxi service

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is 32 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. For over 10 years, Ly has been growing vegetables, flowers and raising pigs, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $7 per day. All of her children are still in her care and in school.

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Ly is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase piglets to breed and sell when they gain weight. By doing so, she will earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business of raising fish for income and help her children earn a bachelor’s degree. She hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for the family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed in order to resale when they gain weight

loans.name: Shod

texts.en: Shod is 54 years old. She is a mother of two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.  She has been selling sugarcane juice for more than 10 years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband helps her run the business.  Her two children are employed in garment factory. They earn about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s finance, Shod is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase fish for resale. This money will help her acquire the security to start new business and earn extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop for her children and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en: Soeurn is 55 years old. She is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Two of her children are employed. They are teacher and garment worker. They earn about $6 per day. In order to improve her family’s finance, Soeurn is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a motorbike for her son to run the taxi service. This purchase would enable her son to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to run the taxi service

loans.name: Sok Kea

texts.en: Sok Kea is 32 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling breakfast food for more than three years, earning approximately $7 per day. Her husband is a soldier who earns about $4 per day. Her children are still in her care. Sok Kea wants to rebuild her house. With this goal in mind, Sok kea is requesting a loan of $1000 to pay for construction service. This money will help her provide better living condition for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to pay for construction service

loans.name: Chan Nimol

texts.en:
Chan Nimol is 25 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fake jewelry for more than two years, earning approximately $25 per day. Her husband is a barber who earns about $5 per day.

In order to improve her business, Chan Nimol is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a store for selling the fake jewelry. This purchase would enable her to own and store a larger amount of fake jewelry. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a store for selling jewelry

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea is 24 years old. She is single and resides with her sister in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than five years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her sister is a vegetable vendor who earns about $7 per day. Chea want to rebuild her present house. With this goal in mind, Chea is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. By doing so, she would be able to provide convenient living condtions for her family. In the future, she would like to run her own sewing shop to earn more income so she can support the family.

loans.use: to purchase constrution materials to rebuild her house

loans.name: 03.5.53 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thiệp Quí has a manufacturing business sewing clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to do tailor-made and clothing repairing service.

Thiệp Quí is 55 years old and she is married with 4 children.. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 53 Quảng Hưng solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents, her children are grown up.

This is Thiệp Quí first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  Thiệp Quí has been involved in this business for 5 years.
The main harship that Thiệp Quí faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thiệp Quí hopes to build a new house.  She aspires for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase machines for tailoring and clothing repairing service.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives in Getashen village with her husband and children. Gohar works at the local school. Besides, she is also involved in farming on the family farm, which they have been running for 14 years. Gohar grows different types of fruit trees in the orchard and cultivates vegetables on the land. Gohar needs an investments to start the land cultivation. She has applied for this loan to purchase seeds and fuel for the agricultural machine. 
Gohar would like to start growing plum trees as this type of fruit is in high demand during the summer. This year, she hopes to gather a good harvest, sell it, and earn more income, which will allow her to add new types of fruit trees in her orchard.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plates and cups for use in the hotel.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a forty-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling timber for fourteen years. His hardships are customers not paying on time, inadequate capital to purchase stock, and seasonal weather. His personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent house for residence and self-education. His business goals are buying land to grow crops, expanding his business into new markets, and hiring employees to help expand the business. James wants money to buy eucalyptus trees for timber.

loans.use: to buy eucalyptus trees for timber.

loans.name: Badee

texts.en:
Badee is a 52-year-old man. He is married and a father of five sons and one daughter. One of his sons is a worker who gets a low salary and another is a university student.
Badee has a grocery store, which is a profitable venture, but also needs more support to cover the costs as well as the education expenses.
Badee is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more groceries that his customers often request, such as rice, milk, and canned food. This will offer Badee a high-variety selection of groceries to compete and to satisfy his customers. This will help to increase sales and improve the family's income. 

Badee is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a twenty-nine-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the bar business for five years and the business has been very profitable so she has been able to construct a house. Her hardships are bottle breakages due to drunken customers, price fluctuation, and inflation. Her personal goals are educating her children and buying a car while her business goal is to diversify the business by buying land to grow crops. Mary intends to use the money to buy beer for sale.

loans.use: to buy beer for sale

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a thirty-one-year-old hardworking man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling produce for five years. His hardships are customers not paying on time and seasonal weather changes that make it hard to predict sales. His personal goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to move his business to a more permanent location. Godfrey wants money to buy cassava flour, maize, and beans for sale

loans.use: to buy cassava flour, maize, and beans

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 52-year-old, married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda.

For 20 years now, she has been operating a stationary shop. Her primary business challenges are customers who often do not pay on time and insufficient capital to purchase inventory.

Her personal goal is to educate children, while her business goal is to expand her business into new markets. Florence is seeking funds to buy books to re-sell.

loans.use: to purchase books for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tires and to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a married woman who is blessed with three children. All of her children attend school.

To earn a living, she sells school supplies, beauty products such as hair pins, nail polish, and cosmetics, as well as baked breads. She has been in this business for almost 18 years. Theresa and her husband aim to make her business more profitable so that she will be better able to support her children's education. She is glad because her husband is supportive of her work.

Theresa explains that she successfully repaid her previous loan. Now she is seeking a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to buy school supplies such as notebooks and paper for her stall.
