She believes that she will succeed and grow her business with the continuing support of ASKI and KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional school supplies (e.g., notebooks and paper)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire labor for farming and quarry minerals.

loans.name: New Africa Group

texts.en:
Leon, who is in her late twenties is single.  She has had a cosmetics business for one and a half years.  She works from 8.00 am to 9.00 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use to buy more cosmetics to resell and to start selling wigs. Her dream is to become an international business lady and to go to China and bring back big quantities of cosmetics.

She will share this loan with her loan group "New Africa" which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to resell and to start selling wigs.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer a 37 year old hard working lady with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She has personal goals of educating her children and building a permanent house for residence.

She has been running a salon business for the last 15 years, after getting money from her restaurant business.  She faces a hardship of customers not paying on time, however,she has a vision of expanding her business to new areas and modernizing her salon to be one of the best salons in town.

Jennifer needs the loan to buy hair dryers for her salon.

loans.use: to buy hair dryers for her salon.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet wants a loan to pay school fees for her children.  She deals in phone accessories and has been in business for eight years.

She is a single mother, age 43, and charged with a responsibility of taking care of her three children.

Price fluctuations, inadequate capital and thieves threaten her business.  She desires to educate her children, buy a car and diversify her business by buying land to grow crops.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en:
Norayr is 32. He lives in Mrganush village with his family: wife, one child, mother and grandmother. 

Norayr works at the local school, and also provides car repair services. However, the main source of income for the family is the farm, where he cultivates land and grows different types of fruits and vegetables in three green houses. 

Norayr grows grape trees in his orchard, and they keep growing each year.  Norayr needs to purchase poles for the trees to keep their growth. He also wants to inject medicine in the trees and cultivate the land with fertilizer, to ensure a good harvest. 

This loan will enable Norayr to keep developing his farm and provide a stable income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase poles for the trees to keep their growth, tree medicine and fertilizer, to ensure a good harvest.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a 50 year old lady with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda.  

She deals in a restaurant and bar business which she started running two years ago.  Constance started with capital she saved from her salary as a health worker with Kagadi hospital.  

She says inadequate capital is affecting the business.  She would like to educate her children and expand her business to new markets.  Constance wants a loan to buy soft drinks, beers and food for sale.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beers and food for sale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 28 year old gentleman married with four children, living in Kagadi, Uganda.

For three years he has been selling spare parts and radios. He started as a mechanic then saved his wages to start his current business. 

He says price fluctuation and inadequate capital are affecting the business.  

Emmanuel would like to build a permanent house and expand his business to new markets.  He wants a loan to buy radios and spare parts for resale.

loans.use: to buy radios and spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena's daily activity is feeding and raising her hogs.  She currently raised one sow and eight piglets.  

She is in need of more capital to provide her animals with proper nutrition.  So, she is requesting a loan amounting to P40,000 to buy stock feed, vitamins and vaccine to improve the growth of her raised pigs.

Lorena devotes her time in her hog raising business because she aspires to gain greater profits to improve her homed-based store, provide for her parents needs and save for her future. 

She is the second child in her family and still single.

loans.use: to buy stock feed, vitamins and vaccine to improve the growth of her raised pigs.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel has been a hog raiser for three years.  He is 28 years of age, married with two children.  His priority is to let his children finish their bachelor degrees.  So, Joel has been doing his best in order to gain a bigger income to save for his children's education.

Joel would like to take out a loan of P25,000 to buy hog feed and vaccine to provide his raised hogs with proper nutrition.  He knows that he could make them healthy upon reaching their optimum growth. 

This would really be a big step in fulfilling his dreams in life.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vaccine to provide his raised hogs with proper nutrition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more iron sheets for her sauce pan business.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is a 33-year-old hard-working woman with two children.  She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her personal goals are to buy a car and build a permanent house.

Rosette has been selling clothes for a period of seven years and this has enabled her to educate her children. She faces hardships of price fluctuations, high transportation costs and the seasonal nature of the business.  However, she has a vision of expanding her business to new markets. Rosette needs a loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 39-year-old single mother with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling clothes for two years and this has enabled her to provide the necessities to her children,as she has sole responsibility for taking care of them. Her hardship is inadequate capital to meet the high demand.  Her personal goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to expand her business to new markets.

Mariam is seeking money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ezira

texts.en:
Ezira is a 29-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the general-store business for four years. His hardships are price fluctuation, inflation, inadequate capital to purchase stock and high fuel and transportation costs.

His personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent home and buying a car. Ezira's business goals are diversifying his business to include farming, moving it to a more permanent location and expanding the business into new markets.

Ezira wants money to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice for resale.

loans.name: Artashes

texts.en:
Artashes lives in Armavir town with his wife and son. Five years ago, this young and enthusiastic man decided to start his own business and become financially independent. He opened a booth in one of the city's busy areas, where he started making different types of fast food that are very popular among citizens. Due to his qualities of entrepreneurship,  Artashes has gained a loyal and ever-growing customer base. 

Now Artashes wants to develop his business and provide services with better quality for his customers. With the help of this loan he plans to construct a new booth. This will allow Artashes to increase his business income and invest in further expansion of his business.

loans.use: to pay for construction of a new booth

loans.name: Kyanya Bakyara Thuwathikana Group

texts.en:
Eddy is 50 years old, married, and has six children.  She lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the retail business for eight years. She started with 100,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings as working capital.

Eddy is a member of the Kyanya Bakyara Thuwathikana Group where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan.  Eddy is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy beans and palm oil to sell. Her hardships are customers not paying on time, inadequate capital to purchase stock, and seasonal weather changes.  Her personal goals are educating her children, buying a car, and building a permanent house. Her business goals are buying land to grow crops, expanding her business into new markets, and moving her business to more permanent location.

loans.use: to purchase beans and palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has been selling agricultural products such as pesticides for the past six years. This has enabled her and her husband to raise their children and provide them with all the basics. Her business challenge, however, is insufficient money to expand on her stock.

Jane is now requesting a second loan from HOFOKAM in the amount of 3,000,000 UGX to buy more pesticides and seed for resale. She envisions going into farming so as to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more pesticides and seed for resale.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a 34-year-old hardworking woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has rented housing for the last seven years despite such problems as delinquent rent payments. She wants to expand her business, however, as it is low in operational costs.

Miriam is requesting a 1,500,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to finish constructing her rental houses. Her personal goals are to build herself a permanent home and buy a car.

loans.use: to finish constructing her rental houses.

loans.name: Sadress

texts.en:
Sadress is a 32-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For the past four years she has been in the bar and hotel business. Her main business challenge is theft.

Sadress is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to buy furniture for her hotel. Her business goals are to move her bar and hotel to a more central location and buy land upon which to grow crops. Her personal goal is to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her hotel.

loans.name: Tausi

texts.en: Tausi is a married lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She faces the hardship of inadequate capital to buy stock for her business.  Therefore, she has asked for another loan to help her buy more synthetic hair weaves and hair oil for her salon business.  She has a vision of expanding her business to new markets.  In addition, she has a personal goal to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy sythetic hair and hair oil to sell.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is a responsible father who owns and manages a rice farming business in his community.   He is 50 years old and has two grown-up children.  He aspires to educate his children and give them a better life. 

Despite the hardships Wilfredo faces farming, he has the determination to improve his farming business and increase his yields.  He has been a farmer for almost 25 years, earning a profit of 25,000 PHP in every harvest.  He utilizes this income to meet the family’s daily expenses and to pay his children’s school fees. 

To improve his farming business, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay the labor cost incurred in transplanting rice seedlings.  He believes that this loan will enable him to increase both his yields and his income as he continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay the labor cost incurred in transplanting rice seedlings.

loans.name: Matia

texts.en:
Matia is 37 years old.  He is married and lives in Kagadi, Uganda with his wife and four children.  

He has been running a retail shop for a period of 10 years.  He raised the capital to start this business by selling his crops.  He says price fluctuations and theft are the main challenges affecting his business.  Matia is requesting a loan to buy sugar, salt and plastics to sell.

He would like to educate his children and expand his business to new markets in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and plastics to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 35-year-old married man with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. For the past four years he has had a shop which he opened by saving the money he earned in his prior business as a motorcycle transport operator. Price fluctuation, inflation and inadequate capital are the main challenges he faces in his shop.

With a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from HOFOKAM Charles intends to buy general merchandise such as cooking oil and salt to sell. His business goals are to move his shop to a more permanent location and buy land upon which to grow crops. His personal goals are to build a permanent home and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 43, married and has two school-aged children. He supports his family by planting and harvesting rice and vegetables to sell. He also raises hogs to make more money.

Edgar wants to improve his hog-raising venture. He is asking for a 20,000 PHP loan from ASKI to buy feed, vitamins, materials needed to improve his pigpen and additional piglets to raise.

Edgar aims to improve his family’s living conditions and continue sending his children to school. Through patience and hard work, he believes that he can give his family a bright future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, materials needed to improve his pigpen and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Friday

texts.en:
Friday is a 35-year-old married man with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. For the past five years he has run a shop and charged phones to earn an income. He began his business with a loan from HOFOKAM. His main challenge is a lack of capital.

Friday is requesting a 1,000,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to buy general merchandise such as salt and soap to sell. His business goal is to move his shop to a more permanent location, while his personal goal is build a permanent home.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo primarily grows rice crops to sell. His income goes to meet his family basic commodities. 

Alfredo is requesting a loan for 45,000 PHP, which he will use to buy farm inputs to improve the fertility of his rice farm so that he can have a good production of rice crops.

Alfredo believes that he could obtain a plentiful harvest in the next cropping season because he is a well experienced farmer and hard working father to his two children. He hopes to send his children to a higher level of education so that they can find better opportunities along the journey of their life.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs to improve his farming business

loans.name: Clark

texts.en:
Clark is a young farmer and married man with two children. He grows rice on his 2.5 hectare field.

Clark is requesting a loan 40,000 PHP from ASKI to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and seed for his field. He hopes to own a bigger rice farm and hire more laborers in his village someday. In this way everyone will enjoy a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and seed for his field.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a farmer and single father of two children. To support his family he has devoted five years of hard work and patience to his rice field. He also sells furniture.

Joel wants to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his field in order to get a better yield this year, but the money put aside for this purpose is no longer sufficient due to his furniture business expenses. For this reason Joel is asking for a 40,000 PHP loan from ASKI.

Joel hopes that his farming and furniture business will continue to grow. He wants to improve his family’s living conditions and save some to give his children a bright future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his field.

loans.name: Eric John

texts.en:
Eric John is 25 years old and has a baby. He raises hogs to supplement his income. Despite the problems and difficulties of life he is determined to persevere, as he believes that through patience and hard work he will improve his business.

Eric John is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan from ASKI to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hogs. He hopes that this loan will help his business grow. He wants to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hogs.

loans.name: Evaket

texts.en:
Evaket is a 28-year-old married woman with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a beauty salon which she has operated for three years, and it is steadily growing. Customers not paying on time is her main problem.

Evaket is requesting a 1,000,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM which she intends to use to buy dryers and steam machines for her salon so as to attract more customers. Her business goals are to move her salon to a more permanent location and buy land to grow crops on. Her personal goals are to educate her children so they might attend higher institutes of learning and to build a permanent house.

loans.use: to buy new hair dryers and a steam machine for her salon.

loans.name: Larba

texts.fr:
Larba est une femme âgé(e) de 59 ans. Elle est mariée å un  retraité. Elle a 03 enfants. Le premier a 32 ans et le dernier a 22 ans.  
Larba travaille comme revendeuse de charbon de bois depuis 2010. Elle vend seule à domicile et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Larba a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbon  Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Larba voudrait agrandir le commerce en ajoutant d’autres activités parallèle. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’assurer son avenir.
texts.en:
Larba is a 59-year-old woman who is married to a retiree. She has three children. The first child is 32 years old, and the last is 22. Larba has been working as a retailer of charcoal since 2010. She makes her sales alone out of her home and gets her supplies in Lomé.

Larba has requested her first WAGES loan to buy sacks of charcoal. She would like to expand her business by adding concurrent activities. With the profits, she says she plans to ensure her future.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Salama

texts.fr:
Salama est une femme âgé(e) de 42 ans. Elle est mariée å un  tôlier. Elle a 05 enfants, dont 04 à l’école. Le premier a 22 ans et le dernier a 08 ans.  
Salama travaille comme revendeuse de charbon et des produits cosmétiques depuis 1992. Elle exerce l’activité à domicile et de façon ambulante.
Salama a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits cosmétiques et des charbons de bois. Elle veut agrandir son activité en ouvrant une boutique et assurer l’avenir de la famille.
texts.en:
Salama is a 42-year-old woman who is married to a sheetmetal specialist. She has five children, of whom four are in school. The first child is 22 years old, and the last is 8. Salama has been working as a retailer of charcoal since 1992. She operates her business in her home and door to door. 

Salama has requested her first WAGES loan to buy cosmetic products and charcoal. She wants to expand her business by opening a shop and to ensure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Célina

texts.fr:
Célina est une femme âgé(e) de 52 ans. Elle est divorcée et a 04 enfants dont 01 scolarisés. Le premier a 30ans et le dernier 22ans.
Célina travaille comme revendeuse de farine de manioc et du SODABI (boisson alcoolisée) depuis 1990. Elle exerce l’activité seule à la maison et s’approvisionne à Lomé. 
Célina a requis son huitième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de la farine de manioc et du SODABI. Elle veut agrandir son activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Célina voudrait assurer sa prospérité  et subvenir aux besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
Celina is a 52-year-old woman. She is divorced and has four children including one attending school. The eldest is 30 years old and the youngest is 22.

Celina has been working as a retailer of cassava flour and Sodabi (alcoholic beverage) since 1990. She carries on the business alone at home and resupplies in Lome.

Celina has requested her eighth loan from WAGES to buy cassava flour and Sodabi. She wants to expand her business.

In coming years, Celina wants to ensure her prosperity and meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: Buy cassava flour and Sodabi

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 39 years old and has four school-aged children. As a hardworking father, he aims to improve his pineapple plantation to increase his yields and make more money to support his family.

The cost of commodities and school fees, however, is high. So he is asking for a 20,000 PHP loan from ASKI to buy the fertilizers and fungicides needed to develop his pineapple production.

Roberto hopes this loan will enable him to improve his plantation and the family’s living standards. He aims to educate all of his children so that they will become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fungicides.

loans.name: Warama

texts.fr:
Warama est une femme âgé(e) de 49 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 05 enfants, dont 02 à l’école. Le premier a 27 ans et le dernier a 10 ans.  
Warama travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes, nattes et foulards depuis 1975. Elle vend à toutes personnes au marché et s’approvisionne généralement à Lomé. Sa difficulté principale est la mévente.
Warama a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes, des foulards et autres. Elle veut investir dans l’activité, l’agrandir et avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Warama is a 49-year-old woman who is married to a retailer. She has five children, of whom two go to school. The first child is 27 years old, and the last is 10. Warama has been working as a retailer of pagnes (the colorful cloth of western Africa), mats, and scarves since 1975. She sells to anyone at the market and gets her supplies from Lomé in general. Her main difficulty is a drop in sales.

Warama has requested her fourth WAGES loan to buy 'pagne' cloth, some scarves, and more. She wants to invest in her business, to expand it, and to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy 'pagne' cloth, mats, and scarves

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged twenty. He is single and lives with ten family members, three of whom work.

Karar has owned a farm since 2010. He sells calves and sheep. He has a sufficient experience in this field. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.
 
He applied for $2000 as youth loan in order to install a ceiling on the farm and buy more cattle food. He is aiming to gain more profits so he has the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to install a ceiling on the farm and buy more cattle food.

loans.name: Mortada

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged twenty-two. He is single and lives with five family members three of whom work.

Since 2010, Mortada has owned a shop, for photocopying, printing and typing. He has a sufficient experience in this field. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.
 
He applied for $3000 as youth loan in order to pay the annual rent for another shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so that he has the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for another shop.
